[CLS] [SEP]i mean you 're not too far back. [CLS] [SEP]and you 're not too far forward .you 're in a nice neutral spot on your bike .so , when you get up to the jump face what 's going to happen is your bike , your suspension is going to compress into the face .as that compresses into the face you 're going to feel it .then right when you 're going to , just when you 're leaving the lip it 's going to tend to , it 's going to. [CLS] [SEP], you 're. [CLS] [SEP]folley is going to , it 's going to become uncompressed. [CLS] [SEP]and it 's going to shoot you up into the air .that 's really when you want to feel out your body and get it ; get it correctly right in the middle of your bike .so , you 're kind of ; let 's say you 're starting to go a little further back .if you 're right in the middle of your bike just move your body up a little bit .move your body up .it neutralizes the bike , gets you that balance .let 's say you 're kind of already. [CLS] [SEP]; you hit the lip of the jump and you 're coming forward on it .well , move that body back .also a nice rule of thumb to do on your bike is when you 're on your bike ; if you start to endo a little bit , endo is when your front wheel is low , you give your bike a ton of gas , as much gas it is .it 's what we call the panic rev .not really something you want to hear or something you want to do , but it happens a lot .what that will do is get your ; get your rear wheel rotating enough with enough mass and. [CLS] [SEP]it 'll ; it 'll try to ; the gravity kind of pulls it back down to the ground .say if you start to kind of come back and your front wheel is really high .it 's what we call looping out .then you 're going to want ; then you 're going to want to grab on your clutch and hit your rear break .what that 's going to do is it 's going to stop your rear wheel from rotating and. [CLS] [SEP]kind of naturally it 's going to put your bike and want to ; want to slap your front wheel down .definitely techniques that are good to use , but you definitely want to have enough practice when you use them .

i 'm going to talk to you about how to use a carpet steam cleaner .now the first thing you want to do before you steam clean any carpet. [CLS] [SEP]is you want to make sure that the area is vacuumed very well .in some cases you might even want to go over it a couple of times .a good thorough vacuuming is very important before you start to steam clean a carpet .the next thing is that there are several models of steam cleaners that you can use at home , there are several types that you can rent .the most important thing is to make sure that you load the detergent in the system that is designed for that particular steam cleaner .ok so you do n't want to mix and match. [CLS] [SEP]or you do n't want to use a detergent for cleaning your carpets that is n't particularly designed for steam cleaning .the next thing we 'll do is that you 'll want to fill your reservoir in this case , this has an upper chamber that you can go and just fill it with hot tap water .in most cases , hot tap water will be sufficient for using your steam cleaning .you want to make sure that as you fill this up that you fill it up to the line that is indicated here .so with your steam cleaning one thing is very important is that as you start you want to , you can move it forward to spray some heavily soiled areas but. [CLS] [SEP]in most cases what you want to do when you are steam cleaning is as you are depressing the detergent button that you want to be pulling the stream cleaner slowly and steadily towards you .ok and in this case you are not really using vigorous strokes like you may in a vacuum cleaner you are using slow , steady .and then you want to go back. [CLS] [SEP]and you want to continue to work this in parallel so as you are depressing the button. [CLS] [SEP]then move in a slow , slow method .what this will allow , the slow steady movement in parallel strokes will make sure that you get a complete clean but it will also make sure that you do n't saturate too much of your steam cleaning solution into that .and then also a lot of your steam cleaners will have a rinse mode. [CLS] [SEP]so you can go back and actually rinse and not leave detergent .and then from that you can simply let your carpet dry , and in some cases depending on what type detergent , what type of system you are using it may recommend that you vacuum it again to remove any of your detergent residue .so i 'm tim gipson and that 's how to steam clean a carpet .

now , the way we do the functional training is to put ourselves , put our bodies into situations that more , again , accurately reflect the activities that we 're going to be pursuing .the type of equipment that i have here that we use is the kinesis system from technogym , and it allows freedom of movement .it allows me to define the movement so that i can create exercises that will prepare people for particular activities .one -- some of the things that it helps with are better balance , more flexibility , muscular endurance , strength , and just general coordination , because it integrates muscle groups rather than isolating them , as i was talking about before .it makes the muscle groups work together as they do in everyday life .balance is one -- is of critical importance for us all. [CLS] [SEP]and it 's difficult to train for balance unless you put yourself in a situation where you 're out of balance and. [CLS] [SEP]your body learns how to compensate for it .if i tell you to exercise the muscles that are going to keep you from tipping over this way , what are you going to do ?what you 're going to do is you 're going to put yourself in a position where there is some reason for you perhaps to do that. [CLS] [SEP]and you make your body adjust to keep that from happening , and you exercise those muscles and become much more aware of how your body works and where it is in space .this equipment , the technogym equipment , the kinesis line , will do that automatically in addition to many of the other things .i 'm going to go through a series of exercises with the system so that you can see how it works .now , each one of these stations , there four stations in this unit : the alpha , the beta , the gamma , and the delta station .we 'll be demonstrating some exercises with each of those stations .each one , each exercise has an upper body and a lower body component .the lower body components are consistent , and there are a series of them .the upper body will vary depending on what station we 're using and each of the stations have movements in different planes , so that you can create different exercises to cover all possible movements that we can make .

hi , my name is derek tarnow .i 've been playing guitar for twelve years , and i teach and perform .in this segment i 'm going to discuss basic guitar chords .first , we have to define what a basic guitar chord is .i tend to think of them as being easy , something you teach a , like , a complete beginner in maybe the first or second lesson .and , something that 's relatively common .so , the most basic guitar chords are like three string chords .which is generally what you 'd start a very young beginner on .like an elementary age student , a late elementary age student , to like , maybe a young girl , middle school student .depending on just how their , their muscles develop .because a lot of times if you 're , like a younger student. [CLS] [SEP], you know , you 're , it 's , it 's really difficult for you to reach your , all your fingers , all the way around the neck of the guitar , and to have any kind of control over what your hand 's doing there .but anyway , the first chord that a , usually a student will learn , is c.so , to play that , just with the three , three notes , it 's the top three notes of the guitar .so this is a g , this is a c , it 's played on the b string , and this is an e. [CLS] [SEP]and that 's a very beginning way to play a c.the next chord will be g.so , this is just a g and a b , and another g.so , you might notice that there 's only two different notes on that chord , whereas the c , there are three .and , that 's because it 's not a complete chord .we 're leaving out what 's known as a fifth of the chord .but , if you stick with guitar , past basic guitar chords , you 'll learn more , what that means .the , the first major hurdle for a student to get over , when they 're learning how to play a guitar , is learning to switch chords and time .and , this is really difficult ,because you 're , you 're doing a lot of things at once .you have your right hand strumming , and playing the time .you have your left hand , switching between all six strings and time , too .and , the timing is n't , you know , you know , just exact .there 's a little bit of feel that you have to develop , to learn how to do .well , a good way to start developing these skills is to start with the really easy chords ,like i just showed you , the c and the g.so , you 'd play like , and that 's like , not something that 's terribly difficult to do .the next step , after that , are , or you can start with a step if you 're a little bit older student , or just get the knack of it , or you know , people , people learn at different speeds .if you already have some guitar experience , and you 're just trying to learn guitar chords , this might be a better place for you to start .playing the c like this .and then when you play the c , you do n't play the low e string. [CLS] [SEP], you just play the c note , which is the third fret of the a string .which is also the , written out as middle c on guitar .and you just would strum all five strings of that .and then you 'd switch to g this way .and , on the g chord you play all six strings .and then , you could learn how to switch strings .some other basic guitar chords are e , just played with all six strings .a , just played with only the top five strings .the d , which is only with all the top four strings .some other basic chords are , a minor , e minor , and some not so basic chords , but still , still basic with the d minor .just played with the top four strings , and f , which is probably the most difficult of the basic guitar chords .any way , with time and a little bit of practice and effort , you 'll be able to learn basic guitar chords .and , just stick with it. [CLS] [SEP], do n't let it get too frustrating .

[CLS] [SEP]it is , the easier it is to push it and pop it out .if your foot is here you may find that you get locked if you ca n't put the weight on it .another thing you want to remember when smith grinding is that you 're going to have to lean back a lot. [CLS] [SEP]and this is going to help you lean back and poke that trick forward and ride it through .and that 's how you do a smith grind .my name is shawn connolly , i 'm from san francisco , california and i. you 're going to want to take basic first aid when your go on your day hike .there are a lot of different ways you can go depending on your personal medical history , your medical needs as it were .you want to make sure that you have just what you ?re going to need for you hike .it never hurts to over prepare .the first and foremost thing that you want to do is foot care because if you do start to get a blister you going to want to make sure that you have mull skin .mull skin is something that you will just cut out .as soon as you start to feel that heat that is established or that is common with a blister .your foot will start to burn .usually it ?s going to be in the heel or the ball of the foot .those are the two most common places to get a blister .soon as you start to feel that heat there , stop immediately , take your shoes and socks off , cut out a piece of mull skin , and put it on there and then re sock , re shoe and you should be o.k .these basic kits here are just general first aid kits with band aids , cut and analgesics , aspirin , decongestants , those sorts of things .depending on how long you ?re going to be out , how many people you 're going to be hiking with that are going to be using each of these first aid kits .so , you can pick that basically depending on the hike you are going to be taken .another thing to consider is cold care .if you 're going in a place , if you 're going to colorado in the winter. [CLS] [SEP]it 's going to be cold .these are chemical packs that you break up and stick in your pocket and they heat up. [CLS] [SEP]so you can actually put your hands in your pocket .you can put them in your shoes and that way you stay warm .

now we 're going to look at the two sides of footwear in the 60 's .the main appearance that was new was the appearance of boots .especially boots as wear for women .previously boots had only been worn by men , maybe in the working environment .women really did n't wear them .they wore evening shoes .and so the mods popularized a mid-calf or knee-high boot .i 'm wearing an example right now .now , these you can see a few things , one , there 's a very high heel .you either wanted the heel to be really high. [CLS] [SEP]or you wanted it to be flat .there was n't really too much in between that .it 's suede , which was a very popular fabric and these are off-white , but it 's a neutral .there was virtually no color in mod dressing , it was white , it was black , occasionally you would have a splash of red in there , but in general it was just white or black .and so these boots really go along with that .i have another pair of boots for the mod look that i can show you .and these would actually have been worn mostly by women but maybe even by men .some men were wearing heels at the times on their boots .and these are a very small heel .they 're practically flat .and they 're mid-calf length which means they 're lower than the boots. [CLS] [SEP]i 'm wearing right now .and that was actually a new length as far as boots or any shoes , really , that emerged in the 60 's .these are also leather you can see .the shoes , really , not much synthetic fabric as far as that goes .leather was really the way to go .and these were especially popularized in england .you 'll see old pictures of the beatles and they 're in boots similar to this .it was really just the mainstay of mod fashion .now , once again , as a counterpoint to those shoes , you have what the hippies wore .and we see similarly to the way we saw in jewelry a really great love of natural fabrics and natural colors .so i 'm going to show you some hippie shoes .now these might not look so dissimilar to something we might wear today. [CLS] [SEP]but i want to point out a few things .one , they are actually genuine leather which means it 's a natural material. [CLS] [SEP]and they 're handmade , once again , which would be really important to hippie culture .they 're also a neutral color ; brown and bronze or tan were really popular .and they 're completely flat .alot of hippies did n't wear shoes at all , they went completely barefoot .but where that was n't allowed or where it was n't practical , like in a city , they would often wear shoes like this .just look at how completely different these are than a mod shoe .these really show you the feet whereas a boot covers it up as much as possible .

upward dog being the sister to the downward dog is going to incorporate spinal flexion and strengthen the core and really open up the chest and the shoulders .coming down with your elbows right underneath your shoulders , curl your toes , extend back and always find your active range of motion by starting here and with a slight bend of the elbows you release the energy through the top of the head .you do n't want to arch in the back , and you want to pull your navel into your spine so you 're not resting and letting that fall into the mat. [CLS] [SEP]so you 're supporting the integrity of the spine , keeping a slight bend in the elbows and looks center , release , retract in the scapula. [CLS] [SEP]so your shoulders fall right out of your ears .inhale exhale really release up to the pelvis into the top of the head , try not to let everything fall into the mat , holding for ten to twenty seconds , breathing inhale , exhale , back into child 's pose or shell stretch and roll up .the biggest mistake you 'll see with an upward dog is arching the back and putting too much hyper , flexion on the low back .your goal is to elongate the spine and reach your energy through the top of the head and work within your active range of motion on your upper dog .

hi , this is yolanda vanveen from vanveenbulbs.com. [CLS] [SEP]and we 're learning all about how to grow bamboo , one of my favorite plants .bamboo is just a grass , it grows no differently than the grass in your lawn. [CLS] [SEP]so it 's very easy to grow in a container or the ground , it 's so simple .whether you buy them as a clump in a pot at the garden center or you start them as a root , either way they 're so simple .basically , all you do , just like a piece of grass , you just divide another piece out. [CLS] [SEP]and then you either plant that in the ground or a container .knowing that this is a running bamboo. [CLS] [SEP]so it will take over , eventually ,so you kind of want to be careful with it .i like to put them in containers or at least in an area where i can contain them , whether it 's between the sidewalk and the street or. [CLS] [SEP]somewhere where they 're not going to become a problem eventually .they 're just an easy thing to grow and all you need is a little tiny piece of root and you can have a new bamboo plant , does n't take much at all .bamboo prefer full hot all day sun , they really like heat and sun to grow well but just like your grass and your garden , they can handle some shade too. [CLS] [SEP]so you can put them in a little bit of shade as well .good composted or good soil is the key too , they want something to grab onto .if you have only clay , just put some compost on top and then put your bamboo into that. [CLS] [SEP]and it 'll grow really well .bamboo are one of the simplest plants to grow , sun , part shade , about three inches deep , make sure that dirt is covered , if it 's a root , it 's covered , the sprout is out of the ground and you can separate it as needed .remember , there 's two types of bamboo there 's the running that takes over. [CLS] [SEP]so you 've got to be careful about putting that in the ground or the clumping that stays more of a clump with more of a like a tree coming up. [CLS] [SEP], they do n't really take over .so , when you 're planting them , make sure you know which is which and plant them in the correct spaces because you never want to put a running bamboo next to a park , for example , where you 're not going to be able to maintain it or a water way where it can get into the water and the seeds can get everywhere .make sure that you can contain them because they are a beautiful plant but like other plants , that can become invasive , you 've got to really be careful where you put them .
okay now i 'm going to give you my thousand dollar tip .i 'm probably going to lose a lot of money over this tip .but this is going to help you tremendously .whenever you get into an injury , for example you 're out pulling weeds in the back yard and you hurt your low back .you pick up a heavy box and you hurt your low back. [CLS] [SEP], you sleep on your pillow wrong and you wake up in the morning. [CLS] [SEP]and you have tremendous neck pain .the first thing you need to do is put ice on it .you can either use one of these ice gel packs that you can reuse and put in the freezer .you can use a sandwich bag full of ice cubes .you can use a bag of frozen peas , it really does n't matter .but you want to put something cold on it .and you do n't want to put the ice directly on your skin because you do n't want to get frostbite .so you 'd like to use a thin cotton towel in between the two .now when you put ice on , it 's going to first feel kind of cold and achy .then you may get a little bit of a burning sensation and then toward the end , you will get numbness .the reason why you feel that is because during the time that the ice is on your body , your body 's going to actually be contracting a little bit .and it 's going to be drawing out all the swollen fluids .so that gives you that kind of burny , achy feeling .but towards the end of the twenty minutes , you will get numbness .now remember , do not go longer than twenty minutes .after twenty minutes , it 'll actually reverse the entire therapeutic process and make it worse .your body will think that the skin in that area is dying and start pushing fluid back into that area .now most people who generally when they get hurt , think that you need to use heat .heat feels good. [CLS] [SEP], it 's warm , it 's fuzzy , it 's comforting .but heat attracts fluid which will increase swelling , increase inflammation and increase your pain .it 's such a very common thing that i see , that someone will be out in their yard pulling weeds or they will be picking up a heavy ice chest or something .and they will have low back pain .then that night , they will decide to sleep on an electric heating pad .and the next day they are in so much pain , they can not get out of bed .so what 's happening is they put the heat pack on , and. [CLS] [SEP]the heat 's increase , it 's attracting fluid and it increases the swelling .so it becomes so swollen. [CLS] [SEP]and so irritated that the next day they wind up here in my office .in medicine in general , they call it the golden hour , which is if you 're in a severe injury , you have this golden hour to save someone 's life .but you can also use this golden hour after any injury if it 's not life threatening , to immediately put ice .and after that golden hour or during that golden hour , you may prevent any serious injury to your spine at all .so once again , please remember use ice , not heat .

today i 'm going to be discussing fielding and more specifically the fielding percentage statistic .it 's really the only statistic that is common amongst defensive players .and the way that you calculate the fielding percentage is your assist plus your put outs .now what 's an assist ?assist is you can pick up as the beginning of an out being made .so it 's the shortstop fielding the ball .what 's the put out ?it 's the first basement catching the ball , so. [CLS] [SEP]it 's the end of the out ok.now to calculate the fielding percentage you simply divide that by your total chances which is your assist plus your put outs plus your errors .ok.so that is going to give you your fielding percentage .the best time to use your fielding percentage for me when i have coached is using for my middle end fielders , it 's very important to know what they are doing from day to day .that is very telling of how your defense is doing .also your center fielder , your first baseman , those are some key positions that you really want to use fielding percentages statistic .my name is jamie cevallas. [CLS] [SEP]and we just covered fielding percentage .

i think that the idea is to dress for the weather .recognize that in many birding situations weather , obviously , can be less than optimum .certainly in tropical situations where rain is an issue , it 's always handy to have a light poncho or even a small portable umbrella that you can pop up during tropical rain showers .if you 're birding on the water , dress in layers with a windbreaker and a sweat shirt or something underneath .in the winter , obviously , it 's very critical to dress warmly with appropriate winter clothing .and these days , so many sports stores and so forth have all manner of outdoor gear and wear .foot wear is especially critical .for many situations in the summer , sandals are just fine if you 're going to be birding by the seashore .at the same time , if you 're going to be hiking in rugged areas , lightweight hiking gear or hiking boots of various sorts .in many cases , it can be wet underfoot , and in some cases , particularly in the early spring or in situations where you 're in marshy areas , actually having boots .and , i have here a pair of what are called `` wellies '' or wellington boots .these are basically just rubber boots .and , they are very effective in that they just slip on .and , you can then not be as concerned where you have to walk .there are boots now that can be pulled on over hiking shoes or sneakers , that if you throw them in a backpack , you can very quickly transition from , you know , sort of dry land to aquatic situations .so , just be practical in your packing .do n't think fashion first .think in terms of , of what 's going to be most appropriate for the environment that you 're in and , what 's going to be most , or least. [CLS] [SEP], i should say , disruptive to the birds that you 're looking for .
the most important part of shooting is getting down the mechanics .in showing you the mechanics , i first want to show you , ?feet placement '' .so when you are placing your feet and you are trying to learn the mechanics to shooting , you want you feet shoulder width apart .balance , so you can be balanced , so that if any defensive man comes in and tries to move you while you are trying to shoot they can not , because you have a firm plant , a firm foundation .next , you want to make sure that you grab the ball so that the lines are horizontal to your body , sometimes you do not always have that option , sometimes when you catch the ball , someone throws it to you crazy , you might have to catch it. [CLS] [SEP], how you catch it .but when you catch the ball you want to try and make sure you have the line horizontal to you. [CLS] [SEP]body , you put your hand right there in the center of the ball. [CLS] [SEP]and you want to keep space , keep the ball on your finger tips and keep space in between your hand and the ball , like that .so , keep your wrist loose , not tight , loose and take your other hand and just use it for basically use it for support .get your balance , elbows up , eyes on your target. [CLS] [SEP]and then you follow through , there you go .you always want to make sure you got a backwards rotation .backwards rotation and what the backwards rotations does is , when you are shooting it , if you have a backwards rotation , it has more of a chance of going in if it hits any part of the rim .so let us go ahead and take a shot , remember you want a firm foundation .`` b.e.e.f '' , balance , elbows up , eyes on target , follow through and remember you are not going to make all of them. [CLS] [SEP]so that is the point of the drill. [CLS] [SEP], you continually try until you knock it down .once you knock it down do not stop .remember practice makes perfect .there you go and there you have it , `` shooting mechanics '' .

so people ask me what is the key to a successful hoophouse and. [CLS] [SEP]truthfully i say just that you build it and that it 's strong and that it 's strong enough to persevere through difficult weather .if you 're like me , once you 've built it you will find enumerable opportunities .whether it 's the heat loving or cold loving crops. [CLS] [SEP]but you need to build one because without a hoophouse you 're still going to be working with limited environment .so there are two basic designs to look at .this is the quancid or the round arch and this is the gothic arch that comes up to a peak here .now this one is very simple and will be a little less expensive to build .this one 's slightly more complicated , you 'll need a little more bracing , however the gothic arch is supposedly better for shedding snow .

alright , this is a game called disgruntled groom , and it 's really funny because if you play it with a whole group of girls at a bachelorette party , you 'll be amazed at how many things that they do that they 're not supposed to .first , you want to make a list of rules .make a list of things that a disgruntled groom would never complain about .he would never say that this outfit makes him look fat , he would never complain about a broken nail , that he 's bloated , he has bad skin , that he needs to get his roots done .he needs to get his nails done .all of these things that a groom would never say .also , things he would never do .he would never cross his legs .so if you cross your legs at the knees and the ankles , that 's something a groom would never do .make a whole list of these things and give each attendee of the bachelorette party a strand of beads .every time they do something that 's on this list , you can take one of their beads .every attendee is going to get a list of all the rules , of all the things a disgruntled groom would never do or say , so that they know that if a girl says , `` oh my gosh , i broke a nail '' , they 're going to steal her beads .at the end of the night , the girl who has the most beads is going to win a prize , and she also gets to keep all the great mardi gras beads. [CLS] [SEP]so if you want to get some really cool ones that have little brides on them , that 's a great thing too , because they 're a great keepsake and a great trophy to have from being the winner of the game .

you know , there is a special rule , a house rule , it could be considered the universal house rule of five-card draw and i want to be sure to mention it .it 's that you have to have an ace to be able to draw four .now frankly , in our , in my demonstration here i did n't include that rule. [CLS] [SEP]and it 's for a simple fact .the rule should really only be in place if you have enough people at the table or enough loose players at the table that you need to be worried about the deck running out before everybody can draw cards .the fact is , this is a four person game , we ca n't run out of cards because it 's five to each for the deal , that 's twenty cards and then a maximum of four each for the draw , that 's thirty-six .therefore , no special rule .but most of the time , like in a large game , someone 's home game , there 'll be a rule that you have to have an ace to be able to throw away four cards and draw four more .so just keep that in mind , but we 're not playing that way for our examples today .

how much does a personal trainer cost ?well , this depends .it depends on your location .it depends on who your personal trainer is .it depends on the facility that you 're at , and it also depends on if your personal trainer is coming to where you are at -- so an at home personal trainer .if you 're going to have somebody come to your house and train you , this is going to be a little bit more costly .if you 're going to go to a gym and have a personal trainer train you , this is probably going to be a little bit more cheaper than having someone come to your home , because you 're going to the facility to get trained .it also depends on the trainer .are you looking for a specific type of training ?are you looking for just overall training ?are you looking for someone that has extensive background and has a degree ?are you looking for someone that has a certification ?well , if the person has a certification and a degree , and also has a lot of experience , they 're going to cost more than somebody that does n't have any three of these things .so , for example , let 's say that you were living in a large city .if you 're living in a large city , the personal training cost is going to be up a little. [CLS] [SEP]b. [CLS] [SEP]it , as opposed to if you 're living in a town , it 's going to be a little bit cheaper .let 's say you walk into a facility. [CLS] [SEP]that for working with a personal trainer it roughly costs about forty dollars an hour on average .
this segment is on long drives and there are three basic power sources in the swing , the hands , the arms and the body .and when you could use all three together in coordination , and use all three at their maximum in coordination , for example , i could use my hands. [CLS] [SEP]but i could also use them with their maximum power .what a difference .i could use my arms , but now i 'm going to use my arms hard .i could use my body , but now i 'm going to use my body with some force .when you could use all three , hard , with coordination , that 's when you will hit to your full potential .is it difficult to use all three and hit that ball with the club head moving towards the target while facing the target ?yes , it 's hard .it 's not easy to hit a ball long and straight .but what more could you do ?hands , arms and body , and all three hard .i got the feel of it on that last one .that went significantly further than the others .but hands , arms and body .learn how to use each one alone .learn how to use them together and then learn how to use all three hard , with timing , and you 'll hit your longest drives .
s a really good place to get good , accurate registration .we 've got a couple test pieces here .the way you use a biscuit joiner is you 're connecting two pieces .we 're going to connect these perpendicular to one another because we 're going to have a box that 's going to be connected like that on all sides .so what you 're going to want to do. [CLS] [SEP]is you 'll put the two pieces the way you want them connected. [CLS] [SEP]and so you get them lined up. [CLS] [SEP]and then you make a mark on each board that corresponds to one another .as you can see here , we 've got the pencil mark that is lining up to one another .you do n't have to worry about being super dead on , as long as they 're very close , the biscuit joiner has a little bit of ,the slot that it cuts is bigger than the actual biscuits. [CLS] [SEP]so you 've got adjustment side to side , so you do n't have to worry about being super accurate on this as you do with other joinery which makes it a good economical alternative .you just kind of go make a bunch of quick marks and then cut the joints .once you 've made your mark , what you 're going to do is you 're going to cut the first one here where the actual board is going into the other board .you can cut that joint first .then on the second one , what you 're going to do is , or what i like to do is put on a little piece of 150 grit sandpaper below the joiner so that when you joint it , the jointer 's slightly raised. [CLS] [SEP]and so when you go to put these together , this board is just ever so slightly proud of this board .when you can come after later after the glue up , you can just wrap that flush to this surface with the router and a flush trim bit and get a nice , perfectly even plane between these two boards because with the biscuit joiner having a little bit of room to slide in there , you do n't want this board proud of this one. [CLS] [SEP], that 's a much bigger problem .but if you can get this board just slightly proud of that one with the little sandpaper trick , it makes it a lot easier for really good accurate results .ok , we 've got the biscuit in this slot here .we take the other board and we put it on , a little drive through here. [CLS] [SEP]and i do n't even know if you can pick up , but this board is just ever so slightly proud of that board. [CLS] [SEP]and we can easily take care of that with the router and a flush. [CLS] [SEP]trim bit and get really good results because like i said , the other way , if this board were to come out proud of this one , it can make for a situation where it can just make for a real uneven joint and it ?s a lot harder to deal with that than it is with this .this is going to make for really good accurate results and is a good little trick to employ when you 're using biscuits to do perpendicular joints like this .

sometimes , one of the body language behaviors you do not want to exhibit are what i call `` closed body behaviors , '' especially if you 're going on a job interview or if you 're trying to impress someone .closed body behaviors mean many things .sometimes , it means you 're just really uncomfortable with that person that you 're with or you do n't like them .they also mean that you lack self-esteem in yourself. [CLS] [SEP]so you 're a bit uncomfortable with who you are. [CLS] [SEP]and you do n't want that person to know too much about you .they can be misinterpreted though sometimes .sometimes , someone is just cold in a room , so again , you have to take into account the situation and the environment. [CLS] [SEP], what 's going on that particular social situation .so if someone is doing this , they might just be cold .as natalie and josh are showing you , closed behavior is going to appear in many ways .now sometimes , we use closure to place barriers in front of our bodies .as you see , natalie has her arms crossed .her legs are crossed away from josh as well .that primitively , this is to defend ourselves from attack , but in this day and age there are many reasons why we do this kind of body behavior .also , we may tuck our chins downward .we may hunch ourselves reducing the size of our target .we may , like i said , protect ourselves by folding our arms , crossing our legs away .we also may shift our head back from the other person and not really look at them directly .josh is trying to get some kind of communication going here with natalie .he 's trying to communicate that to her. [CLS] [SEP]but she 's showing him that she 's really not really interested .she 's averting her glance from him .she 's closed up .she 's uncomfortable .she 's shaking her leg a little bit .many times people do this to comfort themselves when they 're uncomfortable with the person they 're with .keep in mind also that closed body behavior sometimes mean that individual is not comfortable with themselves. [CLS] [SEP]so do n't assume when someone is exhibiting the closed body behavior that they 're not comfortable with you .many times they 're not okay with who they are , so do n't go negative on them and assume that if they 're closing up they may have low self-esteem .

when you go to an outfitter to get some boots , it 's a really good idea to have them measure your feet .you might have an idea of what size you are , but it helps the person there who is going to fit you for boots or shoes , to have an idea of the dynamics of your foot ; not necessarily just the size .so they 'll use a device like this , which is called a brannock .on the brannock , they 'll have you place your foot , and then they have three measurements that they 're going to take .first measurement will be the toe to heel , measured here .they will look down and see what size your foot is , total lengthwise .they 'll also grab your toes and they 'll bend them up , and find out where the ball of your foot is .they 'll slide this to match where your toes bend , and they 'll look over here to see what size that is .they 'll take the larger of the two .sometimes , if you have really short toes , your ball-to-heel length might be longer than your toe-to-heel .the place in the shoe. [CLS] [SEP]-- there 's a certain place where the ball is supposed to be , and your toes bend , and so you want that to be correct .this right here is giving you idea of width , and so they can pick the correct shoe which will match you both lengthwise and also widthwise .if you have any questions , definitely give your outfitter a call .

[CLS] [SEP]but that 's a little bit more than diesel fuel right now .however , it makes great biodiesel and in fact , most of the commercial biodiesel made in the united states today is made from new oil .used oil , cheap ,cheap , cheap .however , you 've got to go out and collect it instead of driving to the store and getting it .now , i want to show you what the difference looks like .first and foremost , when you make biodiesel , both will make biodiesel but new vegetable oil is always going to be easier to make .notice how much clear -- let 's get a shot of that , how clear that is .this is waste vegetable oil .this is oil that came from a restaurant .kinda gross , kinda nasty , kinda smells like it .but we can still make biodiesel from it .however , the gel point of the biodiesel made from the new oil is a little bit high -- lower than biodiesel made from used oil .so , you can make it from either one , it depends on what your pocket book is like .i recommend you use vegetable oil .

now we are going to discuss how to remove a tick from your pet .the first thing to know about removing a tick from your pet is make sure that it is a tick .there are lots of lumps and bumps on our animals sometimes that may look like a tick and actually are n't so make sure that that is what that is .they are little small insects with legs .they are generally going to be attached to the skin and be dark brown to black in color .ticks generally just attach at the head through the skin .they do have barbs on their heads. [CLS] [SEP]and so they are actually quite difficult sometimes to just easily grab and remove. [CLS] [SEP]and so you want to have some sort of instrument like a tweezer or. [CLS] [SEP]if you 've got good fingernails. [CLS] [SEP]sometimes that helps .what you want to do is identify where that tick is and grasp at the head of that tick , not the body , and at the head and then gently with firm type motion , remove it .make sure you 're not grabbing the skin and make sure you get the entire head .if the head is left in the body it can cause a little local infection and sometimes turn to abscesses .

[CLS] [SEP], you have to , you get to explore more , there 's probably more humor. [CLS] [SEP], there 's probably more drama and in sort of straight on voice over. [CLS] [SEP]it 's either a narrative. [CLS] [SEP]or you know you 're narrating something. [CLS] [SEP], you are doing a commercial , it 's kind of like your own voice .where as in cartoon voice overs you can do many , many characters in cartoon .so it 's more lively and fun. [CLS] [SEP]i think to do animation and most people that do straight , straight voice overs aspire to do animation. [CLS] [SEP]so it 's definitely a more sought after field in the voice over field. [CLS] [SEP]cause it 's so much fun to do .the other thing about doing cartoon animation voice overs versus regular voice overs is that you know obviously you get to be a different person when you do animation voice overs. [CLS] [SEP]so you know you can be an eighty year old woman or you can be a four year old kid .in straight animation you 're basically they are hiring you for your voice. [CLS] [SEP]and you sound just like your voice. [CLS] [SEP]and that 's about it .so it 's you get a little more diversity in a cartoon voice over .

another particularly useful knot around the campsite , is the timber hitch .this is usually used to bring , move timber around that you might want to use for a campfire , or if you need to build like a lean-to , or a structure of some sort .anyway , to begin tying this knot , you start just like we have with the other hitches , just by going under.it would be a log in this case , and then you take it over this way , and wrap the loop around , like so .then you just take this end , and go around several times .three or four. [CLS] [SEP]usually does the trick , and then you have your timber hitch , and it works much better on rougher surfaces , such as logs or wood , but you can kind of see how it works , and it 's a really simple knot to untie .you just kind of pull it apart , and it falls right off .

[CLS] [SEP]and we have a seven note scale .but the problem is we are playing in four all the time. [CLS] [SEP]and we are going to need an eight note scale to end up on the one again .so you 'll see here is our problem , one , two , three , four , five and two , one , two , three , four , one , two , three , four , one ,see i had to play the g twice .to get to the g on time with enough intervals in between you want to make a eight note scale , so i 'm going to throw a chromatic note in there .i 'm going to throw the third fret on the third string. [CLS] [SEP]so we start , see how i ended right on the one .( playing guitar ) one , two , three , four , one , two , three , four , one , two , three , four , one , two , three , four , one , you can just also bounce back and forth in the scale to kind of postpone of getting to the one .( playing guitar ) one , two , three , four , one , two , three , four , one , two , three , four , one , two , three , four , one .again a lot of bebop cats like to use those chromatic notes in between the scale and really assigns you to land on one at the appropriate time .the notes in between really do n't matter as much ( playing ) .that is a basic bebop approach to the bass starting on g .

[CLS] [SEP]so you do n't have these snowshoe overlap .so , here 's a good example of going up an incline .when you 're going up an incline , especially with a group , it 's very important to keep distance between each individual , so if one person does lose their balance and fall backwards , we 're not playing dominoes .but , as you 're starting the incline always make sure to remind them stay on the balls of their feet , o.k , and just like going up a set of steps , o.k , they just lean forward. [CLS] [SEP]and they keep the weight on the balls of their feet , and avoid the falling back because that 's what can cause them to fall down the incline .coming down , you 're going to want to keep your weight a little further back , still over the balls of your feet .make sure you 're giving the grips , the claws and the bottom of the snowshoes a chance to grab the snow , as you extend down .

[CLS] [SEP]and then you can have your partner press against as you try to push your leg down , push down on your leg , and then resist up and down .and resist up , you do n't want to go any higher then the hip .so you focus that work load right on the inside thigh .another way would be to take the bottom leg and extend that out , bend this one behind you and as your partner lifts and lowers the front leg , you 're resisting again above the knee joint on the right there on the inside thigh .make sure your partner has their hip stacked , head in line with the spine .and you 've got a nice contraction in your abs to support your back .go ahead and lift and lower .and just lift and lower the leg and. [CLS] [SEP]with each contraction you 're applying passive resistance .eight to ten reps for beginners , ten to twelve and up beyond to fatigue , working the inside thigh , either the bottom leg or the top leg with resistance .

how to care for a gray tree frog .caring for a gray tree frog is pretty easy .you 've just got to be disciplined about it .we just have our little enclosure here , we made in our earlier video .you can see our little gray tree frog hanging out in there .basically , what you have to do , is on a daily basis , you want to check the moisture level in there .make sure it 's nice and humid for him .again , tree frogs , and frogs in general , do n't drink water .they absorb it through their skin , so that 's why we 're not worried about having a water bowl in there .what we are going to do , is on a daily basis , is just take that out , and we can mist down the bedding , so that it 's nice. [CLS] [SEP]and moist.now. [CLS] [SEP], you kind of want to let that dry out in between mistings , so if you 're misting it , and in one day it 's not drying out , you may be misting it a little bit too much , or you need to give it more time , in between mistings .it does need to dry out every couple of days , in order to stop any kind of bacterial growth .another thing we can do , we can actually mist right up into here , for him , to give him a little bit of misting .be aware that if you 're doing that , and you have hard water , lots of minerals in it , you can cause mineral deposits on your plexiglas , and then you have to go in there and scrub it out and stuff , so. [CLS] [SEP]that can be kind of annoying , so that 's kind of your daily maintenance , and then once every couple of days , you can drop a cricket in there for him .make sure the cricket is appropriately sized .you never want to feed a feeder animal to a frog , that is bigger than the space between his eyes , so for that guy , that means no bigger than that or so. [CLS] [SEP], so we 're looking at like half inch crickets , or quarter inch crickets , for this little guy , and one to two every three to four days , is just fine for him , as far as upkeep away , and he will be more than happy in there , and you 'll have a nice little frog , to keep on your desk .

[CLS] [SEP]so it 's in line with your waist .take the waist belt and wrap that all the way around you , passing it through the buckle next through the blue loop .your waist belt should be pretty snug to make sure you do n't fall out of it .once your waist belt is tightened , you 're going to do the final step that 's called doubling back .on this harness , there 's a safety feature that engraved danger on the buckle to make sure. [CLS] [SEP]you know it 's not double back .to make sure you do double your harness back , take the end of the strap , pass it back through the first loop and the buckle you put it through .finally , tighten your legs down by pulling the strap through the buckle .your leg should be snug but not too tight .last step , you have the leg strap here .this will prevent your leg loops from sliding down and becoming loose .i tuck that up and over the back of my harness and clip it behind my right leg .that 's how you put on a harness .

to prepare our wooden base before we start , you 'll want to rough it up a little .it helps the tiles adhere to the surface .so , i have here something that i made .i just put nails into a board until they stick out .this is great for really gouging up a surface that needs to be mosaicked .so you just scrape it up , just all the surfaces that you will be mosaicking .the next step to preparing our wood base for the mosaic is to coat it with a layer of white glue and water .you 'll want to mix up 4 parts water to 1 part white glue and paint that over the entire surface where it will be mosaicked .then , you 'll want to let that dry thoroughly .this will seal the wood and so the grouting wo n't dry too fast because the wood often soaks up the liquid in the grout .so this will seal it so it wo n't soak up the liquid in the grout .it gives better adhering to the tile adhesive .so , you just coat that over completely and let it dry thoroughly .

a good way to get used to using a bosu ball , that prioperceptive neuromuscular facilitation , is ... [CLS] [SEP]a lot of people just look at it and kind of stare at it , and then look at you like , `` what is it ? ''you get on there , and some people will do this , it 's one of the best ways to get used to your platform .we 've taken solid gravity out of the picture with the floor .now we 've got this force in here that 's going to make that kinetic chain move from head to toe .so , the best way , center yourself , back down .it 's just step up , step down .just like you would keep touching something to get used to it , basically you 're touching it with your feet .once you get your balance. [CLS] [SEP]we 've got to stop on the dime :hockey being one of them ; football ; tennis a big one .you want to make sure that you 've always got your knee lined up with that hip joint. [CLS] [SEP]and you do n't got that obsessive lateral force on it .so you can practice coming down , coming up , hold , in a blocking pattern .come down , hold .come down , hold .try to anchor your feet on each side of that circle in the middle of the bosu .again , we 're going to leave our hands here by our center of gravity .we 're going to start with a slight bent position , and we 're going to do what was called 'stick it ' .again , explosive movement , we 're not going to leave the ball .we 're going to come up , stick it , hold .simple movement .looks easy , but you 've got to remember to fire from here to here , all the way down here .it takes some getting used to and everything 's going to want to come forward , gravity 's going to always want to pull you forward .you 're going to want to make sure you land right , shoulders over your hips .boom , stick it .boom , stick it .you can progress .you can go side-side , come down , come back up , and just keep doing it .you 'll get winded for sure .

i have taken off my chain to demonstrate the beauty of knowing how to pick up momentum from the terrain that you are presented with .people call it pumping which means that you are finding the back side , finding the transition in every aspect of the trail , and making speed with it .so chain on my bike , starting here on the slight incline. [CLS] [SEP]i 'm going to make it up that hill with out pedaling .so i take off and just , i have manage to make it all the way of cross this flat section of trail and almost off that trail with no chain .by finding the down slope in the section of the trial and really driving my wheel into it .so not only does that help me generate speed it also helps me maintain control .so in times when i am turning or braking is when i 'm driving my bike into the ground .just really forcefully driving it into the ground to create traction .so there are times that you know that i have to brake traction to keep going quick .we would talk about that in a little bit .but the more you mountain bike the more you look at the trail that you are presented with , with a very critical eye .you see every small adulation there is a hole in the ground here before it goes down .so you want to get over the hole in the ground or push your bike through it , then i weight and get over the back side .so instead of just running into everything you can ride lightly on the bike except when it is going to create speed by pushing down .so as i start again to pump through this section you would notice a lot to. [CLS] [SEP]he exaggerate movements that i make with my upper body and my hips .so what i have done here you see it , it is dropping the chest down , dropping the knees down , and dropping the hips down when i had some back side and picking up the bike and actively unweighted it when it is going to be slowed down .so like around this corner. [CLS] [SEP]i do a little bit of a slide with my tire and also pick up the bike and put it down forcefully on the ground. [CLS] [SEP]so that 's the basic concept behind pumping terrain .

[CLS] [SEP]so we know where our weight is .so the feet are going to be just slightly apart .and we 're going to do this little down up down motion with the feet .now the knees are going to absorb some of that motion .and the accent is going to be on the down .you want to feel like you 're really heavy ,like you 'd really rather be on the ground. [CLS] [SEP]but you 're lifting just enough so that you can get to the other side .so the heels going to go down up down , down up down , down up down .good .make sure your belly button 's pulled in , your chest is lifted .good .now every time that the heel goes down , the shoulders going to go down .so you 're lifting in between two .so it 's , down and down , down and down , down and down , down and down .have the arms out to the sides away from your body .make sure the hands are n't moving with you here .make sure the body is n't moving with the head like this so much .but that , it 's moving a little independently .those shoulders are just moving under your chin and the knees are gently absorbing that downward motion .very good .and just rock from side to side .practice this in the mirror and make sure it looks very effortless .

[CLS] [SEP], you see how you 've got a lot of lines from that expression so doing that repetitively over time can actually break the collagen in your elastin within the layers of the skin and led to a permanent line or wrinkle .one thing that you can do is botox injections and those actually help to relax these muscles within the forehead. [CLS] [SEP]and you can get them any place on the face. [CLS] [SEP]but it helps relax the muscles that if you furrow your brow or scrunch up your face it is not going to basically make a crease within the skin. [CLS] [SEP]so it is going to help to relax those muscles and help to prevent expression lines from forming .if you ca n't afford botox or are intimidated by needles another thing that you can do is a topical form of botox which is the lifting product that has argireline in it which is the main ingredient in the botox injection .it also has peptide in it which gives an instant lifting and tightening effect so you do get instant results from it if you are troubled by deeper lines and wrinkles which she is not. [CLS] [SEP]but you can just pat a little bit on this area wherever you are concerned there is a line or a wrinkle and it is going to give you an instant smoothing and tightening effect. [CLS] [SEP]plus it is going to help to relax the expression lines. [CLS] [SEP]so if you do make a face during the day it is not going to crease. [CLS] [SEP]and it is not going to leave permanent creases in the skin. [CLS] [SEP]and it is not going to break your collagen in your elastin. [CLS] [SEP]is you want to go around and inspect your entire house .you want to make sure there 's no exposed areas where bugs and critters can get inside your house .you want to make sure that there 's no big holes , big gaping holes , on the roof , underneath the overhangs , at the bottom of the siding , down around your doors .there 's numerous areas where they can get in. [CLS] [SEP]and you want to make sure that you go ahead and repair all those items. [CLS] [SEP]the owner of climb on indoor rock climbing in wilmington , north carolina .today we 're going to discuss climbing harnesses .there are a multitude of different type of harnesses out there that you can purchase .some of the differences of these harnesses are going to be the padding , the styles and how they fit .most climbing harnesses that you would purchase are going to be padded for your comfort .depending on what type of climbing you 're doing is going to depend on the type of harness that you purchase .different types of harnesses for different types of climbing are important .for each type of climbing , top roping , sport climbing or trad climbing , you 're going to invest in a different type of harness .with sport climbing or top roping , your harness is going to be thinner and less padded .for trad climbing , when you 're doing multiple pitches and hanging all day , you 're going to have thicker padding and more geared loops .my favorite type of harness is a misty mountain harness for comfort when i 'm trad climbing .again my name is scott and this has been harnesses .
and you maintain the people 's relationships that i 've mentioned before you are going to have a successful club .however , one area that is very , very important is to have safe and up-to-date equipment , exercise equipment .and over the years i 've learned that leasing the equipment , i 'm talking about weight machines and cardio equipment .the technology has not changed that much recently , but every three to five years there is new equipment that comes on and obviously competition matters in this business .i 've found that leasing the equipment is much more efficient than purchasing the equipment and waiting until it breaks .when you purchase the equipment you usually wait until it wears out and that 's usually somewhere between seven to ten years , or maybe longer .if it 's longer than that , it is outdated equipment , and then you are not competitive with the other clubs .leasing the equipment is very convenient because every three to four years. [CLS] [SEP]it 's usually when the warranty runs out , you can exchange the equipment for brand new equipment .incorporate the expense into your operating expenses and it is much , much better way of dealing with it than trying to keep repairing the old equipment and buying a new one every ten to fifteen years .it does n't work and again , it does n't save you money in the long run .

this is an improv game called freeze tag .i like to use it as a warm up. [CLS] [SEP]but some people use it even as a performance game .i find a lot of times teenagers really like to play this game. [CLS] [SEP]cause it 's a lot of ways to a lot of fast really funny scenes .so how it works is you 're going to start with two people on stage and maybe give them a suggestion for an activity that they can be engaged in together .maybe they are making a bed ok.so they are going to start doing that physical activity. [CLS] [SEP], maybe they 're going to start making the bed , and then at any point the director can yell freeze .so when the director yells freeze they need to stop in whatever position they are in .and then a player from off stage is going to come in. [CLS] [SEP]and they 're going to tag one of them out .so i can tag them out and then assume the exact position they were in .and then they 're going to start a completely new scene inspired by this position justifying why are my hands and my body like this .so i might say something like ,alright we 're going to get ready to luge on three , one , two , three. [CLS] [SEP]and then maybe the director yells freeze again. [CLS] [SEP]so now i 'm like this .someone else can tag in like this. [CLS] [SEP]and then i might start a new scene ,oh look it 's a wax on , wax off ,wax on , very good danielson .now paint the fence .freeze , ok and someone else is going to tag in take that position and start a whole new scene inspired by that position .hey man give me five , what 's up , up high alright , down low , too slow , freeze .ok. [CLS] [SEP]and that 's it. [CLS] [SEP], it 's a rapid succession of scenes that are inspired by the position that the player takes .so the scenes can be unrelated , it 's important , it 's a jump and justify game making sense of the position that the person is in .you can tag in for either person in this scene , you can join the three people , you can tag out two people , there 's lots of variations .you can also play a version where it 's a blind freeze tag , where the person who has to go in has their back turned , and they ca n't see what 's going on. [CLS] [SEP]so the director yells freeze. [CLS] [SEP]and they have to really quickly see what 's happening tag someone out and get an idea .so it 's a fun game. [CLS] [SEP]and it helps people to play physically .a good , a good tip for having a successful version of this game is to make sure people move the position , cause you do n't want to have several scenes inspired by the exact same position .so this is a game called freeze tag , fun to do as warm up , fun to do on stage , fun to do with your eyes closed with lots of people or just a few .and it 's a great kind of fast fun warm up kind of game called freeze tag .

alright , now we 're ready to move on to artifactual communication .and i know these are things that you 've thought about. [CLS] [SEP]but i bet you never really thought about them as being part of non verbal communication .well , what artifactual communication is , they are things .things that we have and that 's the first thing i want to talk about .part of your non verbal communication is space decoration .now when i 'm talking about space decoration , i want you to think in terms of your room .your office .your cubicle .your complete home .how do you decorate that space ?that communicates volumes about you as a person non verbally .is it really , really , really , really , really cluttered ?is it immaculately placed ?what kind of art is on the wall ?what kind of things do you surround yourself with ?space decoration communicates who you are .now do you necessarily need to change this ?absolutely not ! !but you need to recognize that the things around you in your environment will establish to other people who you are .

[CLS] [SEP]and then what kind of a swing you might want to take as far as a shorter swing or a longer swing .so , gustavo 's over there ready for a return of serve , what he 's going to do. [CLS] [SEP]and what you might notice is you might notice me tossing the ball up. [CLS] [SEP]but then him moving forward as i toss the ball up .this is pretty rare for a lot of players. [CLS] [SEP]actually , you want to feel like you 're moving forward when i toss the ball , toss it going up .a lot of players will actually just stand there and wait for the ball to come to them .you have to feel like you 're going towards. [CLS] [SEP]so you cut off the angles and have that motion meeting the ball .so we 'll just watch his timing of him going forward and just get the idea of that right now .he went forward when i tossed the ball. [CLS] [SEP], you see that ?going forward when i toss the ball , my favorite drill. [CLS] [SEP]right here when i 'm teaching , ah i could n't bust him. [CLS] [SEP]but that 's the idea right there .you want to feel like once you toss the ball up. [CLS] [SEP]and he 's going for it. [CLS] [SEP]you want to feel like you can catch him if they 're not .yeah. [CLS] [SEP]and you notice that he 's taking a pretty small swing , pretty small swing. [CLS] [SEP], he 's not taking a large swing because you do n't have time .the idea what i like to teach is just treating the return of serve like a volley and if you can do that. [CLS] [SEP]then it 's a lot easier for you just to have more time and to be able to cut off the angle .you feel like you 're just kind of going after the ball verses the ball coming to you .so again he 's going forward. [CLS] [SEP], there you go ,very , very nice compact swing right there .look at that he was , because he was going forward. [CLS] [SEP]he was able to get to it right there. [CLS] [SEP], he was wide but he was able to get it. [CLS] [SEP]he was n't going sideways or backwards ,very important your movement .
when there is a dress code race , which is usually evident at rodeos and some nicer barrel races where there 's more money at stake , they normally require you to wear a cowboy hat .lots of different sizes , shapes , colors , that does n't matter but you do have to have a hat .most places do have a hat fine though .if you lose your hat during a run it 's usually a fine that they fine you a certain amount of money. [CLS] [SEP]so it 's a good idea to secure your hat either with a stampede string or two-sided tape , bobby pins , whatever you have to do to keep it on your head .the other races do n't require a hat. [CLS] [SEP]and so the rest of this dress code. [CLS] [SEP]i ?m going to talk about is , is what most of the rest of them require .first of all , a long sleeve shirt .if you 're going to a jackpot or a gymkhana , that wo n't be required , but any other barrel race normally will require a long sleeve shirt with a collar .if you buy a shirt from a western store , you 're probably going to be good .they just do n't want to see t-shirts and things like that .the other thing that you 're required to wear is a belt .most barrel racers have won a belt buckle of some kind. [CLS] [SEP]and so you 're going to have a belt buckle with a regular belt , a belt buckle 's not necessary .one thing you do want to watch with your belt buckle though is make sure that your belt is tight enough and close enough to your body that you do n't get your belt buckle caught on your saddle horn when you 're running .that 's a hazard that some people face .then you have to have long jeans .you 're not allowed to wear shorts - anything like that .the jeans are to protect your legs with the saddle .when you ride in shorts , the fenders of your saddle will have a tendency to rub on the inside of your knees and cause you to kind of have a little raspberries there .so you 're going to avoid that by wearing long pants and then the last thing is your boots .these are , are my working boots. [CLS] [SEP]so they 're kind of scary looking ; you can tell i use them a lot .but what you 'll notice about these boots is that they have a heel on them right here .what that does is the stirrup is right here and the heel catches your foot so that your foot ca n't go clear through the stirrup .it 's a safety feature that riding boots have that you need to make sure you have on when you 're running .most places will require that you wear a boot with a heel .if you 're going to wear any other kind of shoes , tennis shoes , things like that are not eligible for a dress code. [CLS] [SEP]so that 's basically what you 're going to wear to a barrel race or a rodeo .
another part of your fly fishing equipment that a lot of people do n't think about is the backing .the backing is what goes on before you put the fly line on , so here 's the back end of my fly line and here 's the backing .that 's usually buried down inside your reel somewhere .the backing serves several purposes .one is your fly line is going to be somewhere between eighty and a hundred feet long .if you happen to hook a fish that pulls out those eighty feet of fly line , you usually will have on your reel , a hundred yards or more of backing , so the backing comes into play if you hook a big fish .now , the other thing the backing does is it increases the diameter of the arbor of the reel .since most of our fly reels are single action , that means you turn the handle around once , the spool goes around once .the backing increases the diameter of the arbor in the center .so , that allows you to pick up the line just a little bit quicker by having a larger diameter center on that reel .the other thing it does is , by increasing the diameter of the center of the reel , the arbor of the reel , it allows your fly line to be wrapped around something that 's a little larger diameter .the fly line , because it has that plastic coating , has what we call memory , so it tends to want to stay coiled , so if you wrap it around the center of the reel , which is a pretty small diameter without the backing , then your line will come off looking like an old fashioned telephone cord with lots of kinks and curls in it , so the backing adds some distance if you hook a big fish , but it also increases that diameter so that you pick up your line a little bit faster and it also keeps your fly line from being wrapped tightly around the center of the reel .
hey it 's tony naile. [CLS] [SEP]i want to talk today how to care for your wooden bat .this is a great common sense answer to this .just keep your bat clean .if you use fine tar or any kind of gripping substance on your bat , try to clean it after each and every day .use a substance with rubbing alcohol , cleans it better than most things .keep it dry .keep it bagged .when you 're storing your bat over the winter use keep it stored in the same temperature as much as you can year around .if your using your bat in batting practice , we like to use ankle tape on the hitting surface of the bat .keep from breaking your bat .also if you 're going to , the best to have the same model bat ,the same weight bat exactly as you can , and use your game bat for games and your other bat for batting practice .you need six or seven bats , have your dad buy you some .just care for your bat keeping it clean , keeping your hand grips on there keeping it stored in good temperature is the best thing i can tell you. [CLS] [SEP]is just and do n't loan it out to people that might break it .these bats are very expensive , very important to you .this is how you make your living .thank you .

now there 's a couple more points i want to bring up when talking about what type of container to choose , size and drainage .now , some people make the mistake of choosing a container that is too big for their plant .i say , do n't choose a container that is more than four or five inches wider than the container it 's in .if you have your plant in a six inch pot , put it into an eight or ten inch container .do n't think , oh the plant 's going to grow into this container , because the fact is , most plants do n't grow that fast ,so you can re-pot. [CLS] [SEP]your plant in the next size up , and then re-pot it again next year .maybe once every like one to two years you 'll have to re-pot it .now the exception would be a vegetable seedling .vegetable seedlings grow really fast , or annual flowers like pansies , or different types of annual flowers that you buy in the six packs .those grow really fast , so you could put a very small one of those plants into a much larger container .another thing to think about when choosing your container is whether or not to have a drainage hole .i think it 's actually a good thing not to have a drainage hole if you 're going to put your plant on some expensive furniture , say like a really fancy wooden table , or if you 're going to put it on like a nice hardwood floor , or let 's say that you have your plant outside in the hot sun .if you have no drainage in the bottom , that 's almost like a good thing if you live in a really hot climate , like a desert region , because then you do n't have the water as much .also , with no drainage hole you could also grow water plants , and that 's kind of fun too ; if you make kind of like a miniature pond .so think about these things when choosing your container .think about what size container to choose , what shape of container to choose , and also , whether or not to have a drainage hole .
alright , now we 're going to learn how to do two in one hand , which is eventually going to be your first three ball trick .so two in one hand. [CLS] [SEP]a lot of people find difficult because they try to throw the balls so that they rotate in a pattern towards them .so they end up trying to do this , which is very difficult to do .the way you should do it , the easiest way to do it , is to make the balls travel in a pattern that is a circle from the inside of your body to the outside depending on what hand you 're using .if i 'm using my left hand , the balls should go in this pattern .right hand , this pattern .so , the first trick in learning to just to in one hand , is the same as when you 're doing the three ball learning pattern , except instead of throwing to the other hand you are throwing straight up and a little to the outside , and once again as it 's coming down , before you catch it , you throw the other on up .start with one catch and catch it. [CLS] [SEP]and as you get farther , try to increase your number of catches .but you have to be very careful to not just work on your dominant hand or that 's that only way you 'll be able to do it .so you have to always pay attention to your other hand as well .when i started , a good way to do , learn new tricks , was i would n't count numbers , because i do n't know , for me that 's too stressful .when you start to get to the number that you know you need to break , you inevitably drop .so what i always did , was do the alphabet .sounds stupid but it worked for me .so i would do a , b , c , ok ,well now the next time , that 's my record , i want to get farther than c , and for some reason your mind is tricked , for me at least , that i ca n't see them coming as well because i 'm not as fluent with letters as numbers .it 's so easy for everybody to count .so that 's what worked for me .you can try whatever you want , but the object eventually is to be able to do two balls into and out of the three ball pattern .it 's a very simple trick once you can do two balls .start two in one hand and throw one over , then go right into the three ball that we already learned earlier .

the second tool that you 'll need to bird watch is a field guide .there are many field guides out .field guides for each state , field guides for half of the country , the eastern peterson 's , the eastern fibley 's , coffman 's field guide is for the entire country .if you 're going to be traveling , maybe one for the entire country would be best .if you 're going to spend most of your time looking at birds in your home area , then a field guide for eastern united states , or western united states , if you live there , would be best , possibly .rogar tory peterson , one of the world 's most prominent birders who past away a few years ago , developed a system of field marks in the field guide , where there are actually little arrows pointing to the specific part of the bird , that helps you identify exactly what that bird is .for me , birding is a process of elimination .i see a bird , is it a grackle ?no !is it a dove ?no !i eliminate what it 's not , until i 'm sure of what it is. [CLS] [SEP]and i do that by looking at the field guides and reading the information on the different bird families and the information of that specific species of bird .

[CLS] [SEP]you do. [CLS] [SEP]there 's some basic skills that every actor needs to be as prepared as possible .first thing that you need to think about is knowing your instrument , and for actors , the instrument is your voice , and your body .two very important components to acting well , no matter what form you 're doing .so with your voice there 's things that you need to think about like projecting .you have to be loud enough to be heard , especially if you 're in a live setting .articulation , you 've got to speak slowly and clearly .you want people to understand what you 're saying , you 're responsible for helping them follow the action of the story .once you 're comfortable with those basics then you can start to think about things like accents , having accents prepared can really help when you 're trying to audition for specific roles where an english accent might be required for instance , or a southern accent .once you 've got the voice part down , it 's also time to think about body movement .you see , movement is a very important way of showing your character onstage .i always think about that when i 'm developing my character , how does my character stand , how does my character sit , how does my character walk , if they 're happy or if they 're sad .it does a great job of conveying how you 're really feeling .movement classes can be really helpful for an actor because they focus specifically on how you use movement to perform onstage .now if you 're thinking about musical theater , then you also want to add singing lessons and also dance lessons .a lot of musicals will expect you to be able to sing , dance and act .that 's what they call a triple threat .so classes of any of those things can be very helpful .once you know the basics of how to actually be an actor , you have to find a place to act .look into joining a local acting network , find out what 's in your area , it could be children 's theater , it could be dinner theater , it could be community theater .or if you 're in school , you can get involved at the school level .no matter what , acting is a great time , but you want to be prepared when you go to that audition .so i 'm janice creneti and this is how to prepare to become an actress .
