hi , i 'm les whitley .here today to talk about stretching the muscles of the shoulders .the muscles can divided into multiple different components .ideally the muscles of the upper part of the shoulder as well as the muscles of the upper back .you begin by stretching these as any ; you always want to think about warming up the muscle first .ideally with some nice full range of shoulder rotations forward , backward .nice easy arm hugs crossing your arms alternating one on top of the other to improve blood flow and to warming up the muscle efficiently .the by improving the flexibility start with a straight arm across the body stretch grabbing above the elbow pulling across the body until you feel a tightness in the upper part of the back and rear of the shoulder .holding these stretches anywhere from 15 to 30 seconds to improve flexibility .on both sides of course for good balance then progressing to the front part of the shoulder , ideally with elbow bent slightly lower than shoulder level .use a stable object such as a post or a door frame ; begin by turning your body away from that stable object until you feel a slight little pull in the front .this will also help stretch out the muscles of the chest as well .key point to keep the elbow below shoulder level to minimize the impact and the stress on the joint , holding again for 15 up to 30 seconds for flexibility improvement .repeating on both sides of the body and incorporating daily into a good part of your routine to help improve shoulder flexibility .warming up the muscles that you 're going to be stretching is a key-portent part before you begin any flexibility routine to allow that muscle to appropriately move through all ranges of motions .

this next clip is going to be a one armed row with a rotation .okay , you 're going to take your stability band .you 're going to attach it onto a base .remember to make sure it 's nice and secure .now what you 're going to do is you 're going to grab your band .make sure you have enough distance behind you and you 're going to do a one armed row with a rotation .you 're going to feel some additional torque in your obliques as you turn .so you 're going to start off with overhand grip .okay , when you turn the palm is going to go down .you 're going to pivot your body .okay , you 're starting off in almost a lunge-type stance , knees slightly bent , and you 're going to rotate that right foot out .okay .your shoulders should stay level with your elbow .overhand grip , we 're going to rotate out .okay .you 're twisting almost like into a semi-lunge position , keeping that shoulder and elbow in alignment , palm flat .so you 're almost getting two exercises in one .

so , when we 're doing painting , what we 're really doing is we 're creating these perceptual contrasts .use of red , use of green , is , creates brightness , that we would n't ordinarily be aware of .by using green , selectively , around these red objects , even though it may not be exactly the pattern that 's on there , although that was the intent when the designer of that piece of fabric was doing it .they were using the same technique of off-setting the reds with the greens , in order to make them , each of those colors , more brilliant .so , we have the ability as the artist to control what the brain sees .and so , i use those awarenesses that color does that , and the way that complimentary colors set each other off and make them more brilliant .purposefully , to make the paintings much more interesting .again , i 'm going to continue to refer to my original source material , and take liberties , wherever i want to .what this ends of looking like , ultimately , is a combination of what we see , and what i develop as i 'm working , using these devices of complimentary colors , in order to make it more interesting and to give it more dynamic range , and visual interest and texture .

[CLS] [SEP]and then all of a sudden , they 've got it , and you know it , and they know it .so , here we have an alpaca on a lead , and ready to be taught how to halter train .what we do initially with halter training is we train them. [CLS] [SEP], it 's an alpaca , we train them with their moms , and that 's a wonderful device , is to take the alpaca , the cria , with their moms out onto the road or out onto the pasture and where the mom goes , the cria will also go .and that 's how we initially start them walking with a halter and lead. [CLS] [SEP]and we never force them .we never are harsh with them .we just tell them where we want them to go .and it does n't take much at all. [CLS] [SEP], it 's just telling them where we want them to go .

basic outdoor agility drill .interval training , jump rope .the oldest exercise in the book .what you want to do is focus on keeping your core engaged and only going at your own fitness level .again , if you 're not mohammad ali , i 'm not expecting you to go back and forth .if you 're just a basic person just getting back into the swing of things , you keep your body in motion .always in motion .chest upright , always in motion .now with that same jump rope , you could go , bring it down onto the floor , make a line with it , and you could go into , over , over , over , over , just to have a guide of what you want to do laterally .over , over , over .bring that jump rope back up and go right back into that jump rope again .because what the thing is , what you want to focus on , is constantly keeping your body moving .so that you can stay warm and that you get the best exercise possible .

[CLS] [SEP], if you maybe have a different trailer , most of your utility trailers will just have a flat plug , you can still use the same connection there .if you have a trailer brake on something larger , a trailer like this that 's a car trailer , equipment trailer , that 's going to be wired to this connection , and you 're going to have a box in the front of your truck that you can set the control on the electric brake on the trailer as to how much pressure you want that brake hitting when you hit the brake .you can adjust it if you want more or less .which will definitely help you stop a lot better instead of having all the weight on the trailer pushing your vehicle forward , it 's actually stopping with your vehicle .

a frequently asked question by many patients are whether or not the herbs that we 're prescribing to them are safe and free from things like lead and arsenic , that we hear so often that are coming out of china in certain products .and that is a very , very good question to make sure that you ask your practitioner .there are some brands that are very safe , that they 're doing appropriate testing for heavy metals , such as lead and arsenic .they 're checking for things like bacteria , and they 're checking to make sure that the proper plant has been used in that herbal formula .so , ask your patient-your practitioner these types of questions before you willingly accept that the herbs that they prescribe to you .something else that 's oftentimes brought up in relationship to chinese herbs , and that 's whether or not they have been adulterated with pharmaceuticals or other kinds of over-the-counter chemicals , such as tylenol , or even prescription medications .and that 's something that very few brands have .it has been a problem in the past , but now , with the more reputable companies that have factories that are approved by the fda and have been inspected , they meet good manufacturing programs from the gmp .so , make sure that your practitioner gives you the good quality herbs that are safe .and , unfortunately , when you want to get the good quality herbs , they oftentimes cost a few dollars more .so , take that time to make sure you get the most effective herbs , and the safest herbs , that are available on the market .and ask good questions of your practitioner to ensure that they 're following good manufacturing practices .

alright , first let 's talk about analyzing characteristics .and the first thing that i recommend that you take a look at is culture .now when i 'm talking about culture , i 'm talking about where is your audience from .and you probably have lots of different cultures making up your audience .you might have people , and when i talk about culture , i 'm talking about culture within the united states like texas vs new york , california vs florida .all of us that live in different states , we have slightly different cultures .but i 'm also talking about different places around the world .you might have americans , you might have britons , you might have australians , you might have indonesians , you might have chinese , japanese .whatever it is , first take a look at the cultural makeup of the audience .then based on that cultural makeup , you want to take into consideration , things that could be offensive to people of that culture as you pick your topic , and as you write your speech .so you might have to do a little further research once you find out the cultures of where your audience is from .

now that you know how to juggle , what you need to do is just practice it enough so that you actually can .learning from a video is a little hard , but you need to go home and practice it on your own .and everything should work out if you do it long enough .so you know how to juggle , what you need to do now is find something worth juggling .there are a couple different things that people usually juggle .what i 'm using right now are called loose filled bean bags .and they 're just , they 're just like a hacky sack or something , just a very loose bean bag .a lot of jugglers use these for higher number juggling .if you 're juggling five or more .i like them a lot. [CLS] [SEP], they 're easy , they 're soft .i think they 're pretty .a lot of jugglers like to use perfect spheres however , instead of the loose bean bags .what i have here are a couple of different kinds of balls that normal jugglers use .this would be a tight filled bean bag , you can get these or the loose filled bean bag online .and there 's a lot of different juggling vendors around .these feel pretty similar , they do n't roll when you drop them which is always a good thing .and they 're pretty easy to learn how to juggle .this is what a normal juggling ball would be .there 's also what are called stage balls similar to this .a stage ball will be a sphere , it 's usually made out of hard rubber .this one 's rubber foam , but they usually do roll a little bit if you drop .they 're usually much bigger , kind of as a visual effect for people who are juggling on stage maybe .and professional jugglers who do three ball routines or circus jugglers often use stage balls .there 's also one of my favorite types of ball , it 's called a russian ball .now this is a homemade russian ball , but you can find them online as well .and what a russian ball is , it 's a plastic sphere with a grain in it of some sort .like this one has birdseed in it .what happens is it will juggle just like a normal sphere , but it 's lighter than a solid filled and when you drop it , it wo n't roll because of the grains inside of it .so this is one of my favorite things to juggle with .and you can get them online with different vendors , or you can make your own like this .
so there are a couple of things you can do to make it a simple process .the most obvious thing is to make a list of everything you have .not only should you use a written check list but you should also make a count of everything you have and every time you move equipment , just do a count ;1 , 2 , 3 , 4 , 5 , 6 , 7 , 8 make sure you have everything .much like people do wi3th luggage .keep all of your items labeled .you can do it with a sharpie , you can do it with stickers .stickers are actually a great way because if you are in a dark club , people may not be able to read the little notes that you have on your amp. [CLS] [SEP]but if you have a giant sticker , you will know whose amp it is and whose guitar case it is .when you are traveling with your equipment , try to keep all of that in the same place as much as possible .once you get into a club , find one corner that is going to be your corner and put all of your stuff over there .when you finish a show , take all of your equipment off of the stage and put it in a corner back where you had it before .try to keep everything together .any kind of cables should go right back in the bag where you are transporting them and label all of your cables because cables are really what you will loose .you leave a cable lying someone else will decide it is theres , it will belong to another band or it will belong to the club very quickly .keeping track of all of your equipment when traveling can be a pain. [CLS] [SEP]but it is worth taking the extra 20 seconds to do a count or to check the labels to make sure you have everything that belongs to you .because that little amount of time is really worth a great amount of money and time you put in having your equipment. [CLS] [SEP], you squat low keeping the back straight , the head up .that 's how you perform the small bow stance in the praying mantis style .

in this segment we 'll talk about rolling the joints .we begin with rolling the neck , now when you do this it 's not about trying to use your muscles , trying to do a big movement .it could be a very , very small movement but what you want to do is to move from the perspective of the spine itself .so you have to really look inwardly. [CLS] [SEP]and you go both directions .and then you do that a number to times. [CLS] [SEP]and then you move into your shoulders .now this idea is not do a big shoulder roll , it 's just really very gentle , very small .and you want to be paying attention to the way your shoulder joint. [CLS] [SEP]actually feels as you go in both directions .then we move our way down into our hips .when you do the hip joint , you have to let your knees be a little bit soft , if you do n't it will lock up your hips .again this is very small , so when you roll your hips you can envision that you are standing in a pool of water .so you 're just rolling your hips or rolling and swimming in that water without any stress or strain at all .now when you go to your ankles what you can do is hold on to a chair and touch with your toe .rolling your heel , drawing a circle with your heel in both directions .and then finally we work our way up to the wrists and we clasp our fingers together , making sure we touch the palms and letting the wrists roll to get a nice natural smooth motion of the wrists .

[CLS] [SEP], you get all the information you need in regard to the route , the amenities on the route , and what to prepare for , what to bring , what not to bring , et cetera .keep in mind that all of amtrak 's trains are smoke-free , so always leave your cigarettes at home .once you buy your ticket here online , very simply , take your voucher and your reservation number down , the day of your trip , to the amtrak departure area and you could print out your ticket at an automated kiosk .it 's just that easy .i 'm russ handler , and that 's how you do it .

today we 're going to talk about the parts of a skateboard .first and foremost you have the deck .on the deck , you apply the grip tape , the grip tape 's used to help your feet stick to the skate deck when doing tricks .next we have the trucks .the trucks of a skateboard are like , are also called the axles .you have the truck , the base plate , the bushings , which act like a shock or a cushion when it comes to turning , and the axle nut .by adjusting this nut you can loosen it to steer better , or tighten to steer less .next you have your wheels , inside each wheel is two ball bearings .these bearings sit inside the wheel , one on the front side , one on the back side , they mount to the truck like so .next up , you have the riser pads .the riser pad goes between the skate deck and the truck to provide cushion and clearance between your wheels and your board .you need this clearance for your turning radius so your wheels do n't scrape your board .last but not least , you have the mounting hardware .the mounting hardware goes through the deck , through the riser pad , and through the truck , and twist the nut onto the hardware screw , securing the deck , the riser and the truck all together .these are the basic components of a skateboard .
in five card draw poker , every player that is playing would actually put in an ante to put in the original pot .each player is then dealt five cards .they will then look at their five cards and decide if they like the five cards they have or if they would like other cards .initially , once they 've seen their cards , it 'll move to the dealer 's left and that first player will have the chance to actually make a bet .they can either bet , check or basically pass .if they pass , the next person in line will be the one responsible for making the bet .after all the betting round is over , they will then look at their cards and will have an option of discarding some cards and getting cards in return .so let 's say i had a hand. [CLS] [SEP]and i had three tens , a nine and a four .obviously i 'd want to discard the nine and the four .so i would say i want two cards .i would place the two cards on the table .i would get two cards in return hoping to make my three of a kind a better hand .this will go around the table 'til everybody 's done .once they have their their new hand , they can then again , the betting goes in the same the same fashion .you will then decide if you wanted to bet again based on your hand .you can check , you can bet .now if you bet ten and somebody wants to raise you , they can do so. [CLS] [SEP]and then it would be your option as it came back to you to call that raise .that 's the basics of five card poker .hope you get a lot of aces !my name 's dean hale .thanks .

[CLS] [SEP]and that 's how we started becoming a bakery .
i 'm here to speak to you about how to arrange vacation time after divorce .now , very often , each parent wants to take their child with them to the , a vacation , a summer vacation .and sometimes you have conflicting times when you , vacations may fall at the same time .this is very important to work out ahead of time .if you 're lucky , you 'll do it at the time of the divorce and it becomes part of your divorce papers .what many parents do , is use alternate years .for instance , on odd years , the mother has the child for vacations , and on even years the husband takes the child for vacations .they may do the same thing with christmas and new year 's vacation , thanksgiving .one parent may get the odd years and one parent may get the even numbered years .and , that way , it 's all pre-set and pre-established , and both parents get to share in the child 's welfare .where you have difficulty is when each parent wants the same time , and that 's obviously not going to happen .ah , hopefully both of you will co-operate with this .if you have it pre-set and pre-planned and adhere to that plan , you 'll all have a much happier child in the long run .and , i think that 's what we all look for , mostly for the benefit of the child .i wish you luck in your extended families and in your future endeavors , good luck and god bless .

and i 'm here to answer the question. [CLS] [SEP], how do i legally change my name ?well , the process is going to vary from state to state , for the most part , but it has evolved into a very simple process .in fact , this is something that most individuals can do without a lawyer .what i would recommend is that you go to your local court clerk 's office and ask for the form for changing your name and ask for some assistance in filling out the form and proceed accordingly .now there are some things you should know about changing your name .first of all , if you 're going through a bankruptcy proceeding , you probably will not be allowed to change your name until that bankruptcy proceeding has concluded .if you are in the midst of a criminal prosecution , you probably will not be allowed to change your name until the conclusion of that criminal prosecution .but other than that , it 's a very simple process .you pick a name , you decide the name you want to be changed , you complete the paper work , you submit it to a judge for approval. [CLS] [SEP]and it 's pretty much a done deal .i 'm robert todd and thank you for watching .

ok.so , there are three types of pressures that we use when we 're working on a horse .light pressure to warm up with .moderate pressure to kind of really work the area .heavy pressure as a horse gets used to the moderate pressure and then back down to a light pressure as a closing stroke .so , let 's look at spy 's chest , for instance .when i 'm working on this , i 'll start by doing light pressure , just back and forth to get him used to me touching him there and get used to the sensation of what i 'm doing .moderate pressure .and heavy pressure .and what that 's going to do is really get the blood circulation going in that area .the impact of my hand is going to help loosen up the muscle tissues .and then you back down again to lighter pressure to close with .
the stance that we 're going to be learning today is called our steel stance .the steel stance is mainly used to go ahead and advance forwards without bringing your body weight through the position .to perform the steel stance , melissa is going to go ahead , and let me have you turn to face this , melissa .let me have your feet twice the width of your shoulders .the same distance that we would be for our bow and arrow stance or our horse stance .bring them in just a little bit closer , right there .ok , placing the hands onto your waist .now , this is a twisting position , so melissa is going to turn her head this way , she 's going to allow her left foot to turn all the way out totally in this direction .at this point , she 's going to bring this shoulder forward , turning , and she 's going to shift away forward , and look over your this way .there we go .this way .now , this leg is straight , with your heel pointing up .this knee is bent , and we want to try to keep the knee over the ankle .now this position , in the beginning , this is a fine level to start at .eventually we want to work it to where our thigh is level with the floor .want to relax the torso , right , and relax your ribs so you get a nice , good twist .this is how we perform our steel stance in kung fu .
one of the most dangerous places. [CLS] [SEP], i think for children to be alone , are in public restrooms .probably the best way to avoid public restrooms is to have your children go , before you leave the house .if you have a very young child , a toddler , up to toddler age , or up actually , up to about four or five , you can actually carry a potty in the car .not that you would let your four or five-year-old go into a bathroom .in fact , no children should be allowed to go into the bathroom by themselves , under the age of ten , into public restrooms .but , one of the easiest ways to deal with using the bathroom with a younger child is carrying a potty in the car .if your child is just too big for something like that , then you really are going to want to always accompany your child into the bathroom .it 's never safe for you to just send your child in and even wait outside .there have been cases of things happening to children , while adults stand outside of the bathroom .so , that 's a very safe , important tip , and also if you have an older child , particularly a daughter , you 're going to want to encourage her to always go to the bathroom , with a friend .if she 's out shopping , or at the mall , or just having fun with her friends , it 's ...there 's always safety in numbers .so , always encourage your kids to use public restrooms with caution , and with a buddy .
as you 're learning how to spin poi , it might not be obvious at first. [CLS] [SEP]but the awareness of the upswing and the downswing of the poi are very important in manipulating them to move in different directions .if you 're having a hard time turning. [CLS] [SEP]just think about exaggerating the downswing and the upswing until you get an intuitive feel for it .if i 'm going to be turning with my poi spinning forward , down , and then with them spinning backwards , up .it 's actually helpful to have your whole body get into the down and the up , to get the feeling of when the timing is for the poi to move .down , up .let your body lead you as you feel the weight going down and up and eventually , you should be able to turn in a full circle in both directions .while you may have to think about it a lot , at first , after some practice it will just become natural .
now i 'm going to show you some more scales to improvise over the key of b flat .first of course is the key of b flat major scale 1 ,2 ,3 ,4 ,5 ,6 ,7 , just go on and get it under your fingers .then using the bebop technique you can add in side notes , those little chromatic passing tones .for you people who do n't know what chromatic passing tones is chromatic means using every note , the passing tone is using a note outside of the scale to get into the next note into the scale .you got the bebop blue scale , the top of the black notes. [CLS] [SEP]2 bottom are the other 2 black notes .2 white notes in between and on the top 2.so you got top 2 , top 2 , and the 2 notes in between .then you got your hexitonic scale which uses the triad below the b flat , the a triad is a half step below .so you have all these half steps .so those are just some hip scales to play over the b flat , feel free to experiment , try to find your own chords .in the book of scales there is over 15 ,000 scales able to be played. [CLS] [SEP]so do n't worry if you ca n't do this all ready .it 's just kind of the motion .so just do that with your fingers anyways to get the feel of it .what you do is you hold the yoyo in between your thumb and your middle and pointer finger .hold it just like so. [CLS] [SEP]and you use your thumb to snap the yoyo off like that .that 's what 's giving it all that spin .so watch me here as i take my thumb and pointer. [CLS] [SEP]and i push up with my thumb as i 'm holding it with my middle and pointer finger , like so .and see how fast it gets spinning from that .and from there you know you can go right into tricks. so a little bit earlier on in some other series you might have seen me lift my pinky finger a little bit when i was first showing you the bow hold .this is just to show that the pinky finger is really a stabilizer. [CLS] [SEP]but really if you have a strong bow grip you find that the pinky finger does n't really need to be there at all .now you can actually hold the bow without it , when you 're playing however you should have your pinky finger down .this is just to show stability and after you 've been practicing your bow hold for a while that your hand should start to stabilize and you 'll find after a while your pinky finger really is kind of a guiding finger like this .so you can lift it up and down and everything else stays the same .really it 's your other four fingers that are helping to balance your bow especially your thumb that 's coming up from the bottom .but one thing you can try that will teach you stability in your bow a , maybe after you 've been practicing your bow hold for a while. [CLS] [SEP]is to try lifting your , your , pinky finger up just a little bit .this will show the stability that you have in your bow hold .it also shows that your other fingers are positioned nicely on the bow .

today i 'm going to help you look how to create an intention .what is an intention ?an intention is something that you seek out to have .an intention is something that you set forth .say we 're talking about golf , and of course brad is a top one hundred golf instructor in the country , so we will be talking to him in just a moment about the intention that he has set for himself regarding his golf game .so how you create an intention is you look at where you want to be , not where you 're not , where you wish you could be ,where you hope you could be , but exactly where you want to be .it all begins with believing that you can be where you want to be .that 's how you begin creating an intention .so brad , let , let me ask you , what intention do you want to create regarding your golf game ?well i want to be able to play competitive golf with not. [CLS] [SEP], i do n't have a lot of time on my hands like what i used to .so i need to be more efficient with my time. [CLS] [SEP]and i want to keep my competitive game at a good level where i can have fun .very good .so he wants to work on his golf game knowing that he may not have the time he used to have to dedicate to playing competitively , yet he wants to see himself as a competitive golfer , all the while having fun .do you see that this is different from where he may have been ?perhaps in the past he was playing golf and feeling like he could n't have all of that .but instead , we 're looking to create an intention .an intention of something positive of where you want to go .now brad , does it feel different to speak as if you are where you already want to be which is different than remembering where you used to be ?at first it certainly felt different and very weird , but now i 've become so accustomed to it and it feels good .great .so it feels awesome to create where you want to be and act as if you 're already there .great .that is exactly how you create an intention .look to say where it is that you want to be instead of saying where it is that you are now .

there 's four different types of fire you can learn , and use them in different scenarios .if you want to cook , the best fire for you is use the log cabin fire .this is really good , because the log cabin fire is really ventilated , so it gets a lot of oxygen , which helps put off more heat , but most importantly is the logs freely fall on top of each other as they burn , and they make really , really good pieces of coal that put off really good heat , to where you can transfer them ; put them on top of a dutch oven , up under it in a different location .second type of fire is a tepee fire .this is going to be great in case. [CLS] [SEP]you are really cold .snowy climates this is good , because this puts really good heat off .it concentrates the heat into the area right surrounding you ; does n't dissipate very really very fast , so the tepee fire. [CLS] [SEP], you just pile it up just like a indian tepee , and let it burn , and it 'll keep you really , really warm .third type of fire is going to be your lean-to fire .this is when you have the big type , big log beside your fire pit , and you prop other limbs on this .this is going to put off good heat , but it 's also going to help light the area. [CLS] [SEP]really well .if your tent 's on one side of the log , put your fire on that side , and that log will block the heat and the light , and it 'll mainly force it towards your side of the campground to where you light your area really well .and you just want to keep piling wood on this. [CLS] [SEP]so it burns really , really bright , and always has a tall flame .and the fourth type of fire you can build is a signaling fire .with a signaling fire you want to sort of combine your log cabin and your tepee .this is so you have a really big base , and it burns really bright , and that you have an area that you can throw stuff on top of to make your signaling .and this is how you can demonstrate different types of fire .
some desert dwelling animals like to burrow a little bit. [CLS] [SEP]and they used it to form themselves a nest .so that is really important for their well being. [CLS] [SEP]and then the jungle earth here. [CLS] [SEP]so there is no need for a 3 '' depth .for the aspen snake bedding i like to put at least 3 ''deep simply because the snakes that live in that type of bedding are burrowers .they like to hide under it. [CLS] [SEP]and it 's a source of security for them. [CLS] [SEP]so providing that depth is pretty important .for animals such as turtles that live in burrows. on stage , cast size is usually limited .we 'll look at some exceptions on this rule as well .in the modern theater , you usually want to have four to six characters in your play .that gives the actors a chance to have a meaty role .and also , if you 're a producing company , you want to get a play to where you 're probably not paying like 100 actors unless you 're on a broadway budget .in a cast size also to consider are the exceptions to the rule such as musicals or high school productions .it 's a big secret that musicals are probably the most lucrative form of theater ; they 're very spectacle orientated , and you can have a chorus line , and you can have all kinds of big events happening .and so , in musicals , you might require a lot a large cast. [CLS] [SEP]and you can get a large group of people to audition for a musical whereas a drama , you might have slightly smaller turnouts .also in high school , high schools are looking for a play that can encompass the entire class .you do n't want to have a four-person play , and then have the rest of the 20 students in the class having nothing to do .you can only have a few technicians and a few people on book , so at that point you want to have a large cast .you want to have something you get everyone involved .so there are exceptions to where you might want to go with a larger cast size .but traditionally , in the modern theater , if you 're writing a comedy or drama or something you want widely produced in colleges , in regional theaters and even on broadway , you probably want off of broadway , probably not broadway. [CLS] [SEP], you probably want to go with the four to six cast size .

[CLS] [SEP]and you can measure , take measurements of the rooms and then put it up on graph paper .graph it out .so i did .i graphed my apartment , my new apartment on this sheet of paper .and then along the same lines i went ahead and measured my furniture and made little model pieces of furniture .and what this allows me to do is. [CLS] [SEP]it allows me to be able to kind of organize my furniture and to understand if i 'm going to be able to fit everything in to my apartment .and something that i found out is that i 'm not going to be able to fit any of my rugs unfortunately in to my new apartment .they just do n't fit in the spaces that i would like to put them in .so what that helps me know is that i can sell my rugs before i move. [CLS] [SEP]is to have them skinny along the leg. [CLS] [SEP]and then flare out at the bottom .it 'll make the overall look elongated and obviously with these kind of drawings , that 's not necessary but with a drawing like this and with a fashion model it just serves to reinforce that whole point even more so and almost like a character of a person .which is what they really are , but if you make your drawing extra skinny as a opposed to skinny drawing then it just drives home you 're whole idea to whoever your viewer is , to whoever you 're selling your collection to , to people who buying your collection .normally , woman want to look thinner , if you show them this they 're going to be like `` oh !those jeans , i want them , they make my legs look long , make my legs look thin '' .you 're mind. now i 'll discuss starting your own teleprompter business .when i started my business in dallas , texas in 1986 , there was not a lot of competition .dallas was a booming town in our industry .conventions , shows , commercials , and a great deal of corporate work to be had as well .before i started my business , i researched the market need in my city and even in nearby cities and states .i discovered there were just two teleprompter companies in the dallas/fort worth area .and only one had a computerized teleprompter at the time .there certainly was room for me .that year i attended nab or national association for broadcasters convention , and looked at all the teleprompter software and hardware companies there .i decided on telescript. [CLS] [SEP]and i 've used them ever since .my first computerized system was run on a commodore 64.my competition was running off of an atari .both of them were game computers , but at that time they could handle the graphics for teleprompting .in those days , seventeen inch monitors were used for shoots and shows .very heavy equipment indeed , but very effective .the cameras were larger and heavier too , so balancing the camera set up was less intensive .it took a few months , but once i got the word out that i was the new gal in town with a new computerized teleprompter system , my business took off .
today we 're going to do some demonstrations on how you can do creative coloring for your pet .we use completely safe nontoxic materials .one technique you will see we will wash off pretty much immediately .the other technique fades over time and it may take up to 6 weeks to wash off completely .okay , we 're back here with bella , our little yorkshire terrier , who 's actually grown to look a schnauzer .we had done her in the purple .you can see that on the darker hair , the purple really comes out almost like a highlight .then on the lighter coat , it comes out much more purpley .the deeper areas where we did n't work it in. [CLS] [SEP]so good .she has some of her natural coloring under there .it gives her a nice pretty layered look , and she 's all done .
you can take a plant which starts out as a bulb and just put it in a jar which contains water .if you do n't have a special jar that really contributes to the growth of a plant , you can just take any little small container , throw some water in it and just put your bulb in that water. [CLS] [SEP]and it will grow as you can see .and maybe if you get a small pot like this one , you can take this bulb and replant it into some soil into this pot .make sure that you keep the soil very very wet so that it is almost like living in a swamp and the plant will flourish .also if you have a small fish tank or fish bowl , you can get plants which grow in water .if you are taking a plant and putting it within a fish tank , be sure that you have the right kind of lighting which the plants need to grow .a lot of times people make a common mistake that a fish lamp which comes with most fish tanks is enough light to grow a plant within a fish tank .it is actually false .you will need a separate light to put over your fish tank in order for that plant to grow .but if you have a small fish bowl like this one , you can take a plant which once lived in soil such as a peace lily and submerge it in the water , place it under some rocks so that the roots have a place to go and you will notice in time that new sprouts and new leaves will grow and the plant will flourish there in the water .

there are many different drum sets , and when you 're a new time drummer , it can sometimes be very overwhelming because there 's so many different brands , so many different kinds of drum sets , it 's pretty crazy .but really it 's all about what kind of style of music you 're doing is what 's the best way to decide what kind of brand you want .there 's ibanez , the ludwig drum sets , but it all depends what style you 're doing .like if you 're getting in to a metal band you 'd want to get a bigger drum set , lots of toms and lots of cymbals do to all those fills and things like that .and a lot of times those are ibanez .for me personally in my band. [CLS] [SEP]i have ludwig which is simpler. [CLS] [SEP], there 's less drums , there 's not hundreds of cymbals and everything like that .i like to keep it simple .so , there are many different kinds , but really it all depends on what kind of style you 're looking for .and when you 're in a music store as well there 's also people to help you out with that as well .so , those are a few different kind of drum sets that i know about .

chinese writing is very different from most other languages in the world .in the chinese writing system , chinese symbols represent each character which corresponds to a single spoken syllable .a majority of words in all modern varieties of chinese require two or more characters to write .many chinese characters were adopted according to their meaning by the japanese and korean languages to represent native words , disregarding pronunciation altogether .chinese characters are also considered to be the world 's longest continuously used writing system .

[CLS] [SEP]and you do these with tongs if you do n't want to be too close to the broth .you just kind of drop them in there .they wo n't create too much of a splash .this gets them cooking sooner than all the other vegetables and things because you want to be able to cook the rice that is inside the meatballs .so we are going to re-roll them a little bit and then drop them in .

schmuel : when you 're making great macaroni and cheese from scratch , you make a roux .and a roux is a thickener that 's made by mixing butter and flour together and cooking it. [CLS] [SEP]and then you add your liquid to that , the milk and dairy and stuff .so we need for this recipe , we need a half of cup of butter .it goes into our sauce pan .and for this one , you need a large sauce pan because in this pan , we 're going to be combining all our boiled milk , our cheeses and our pasta .so make sure it 's big enough .and to that , we will add a half a cup of flour to the melted butter .it 's almost melted .we can just add that now like so , and you take your whisk. [CLS] [SEP]and you just whisk this together .i 'd say for about 5 minutes until it just starts to turn brown. [CLS] [SEP]'cause what happens is , you do n't want it to get too brown , 'cause you know how like brown butter tastes like brown butter and that will be a little bit too strong of a flavor of a roux for this .you can use darker roux flavors for different recipes , but like i said for this one , that would be a little bit too strong .so here we go , this is great .this is coming along very nicely .i 'll let you see how that looks , the roux .it 's just a flour and butter paste .absolutely lump free as it comes together .and we 'll just keep mixing this together .so keep clicking , and we 'll show you how what we add to the roux , okay ?keep clicking .
alright , what 's a good `` p '' word ?oh we have so many wonderful words in calligraphy .`` proportion '' , obviously the word proportion , you know having to do with a relative size of things , plays a very , very important place , and you must be very aware of this .`` patience '' is a really important word , it definitely takes patience to learn this , tremendous amount of patience .so what i would advise you is to be patient with yourself .i do n't think that many people think that way , they think about being patient with others , or being patient with something .but what i 'm going to say is in order to learn calligraphy , this needs to be paramount , you need to be patient with yourself . [CLS] [SEP]`` practice '' , is absolutely essential .there 's going to be no difference between practicing calligraphy and practicing any other thing that takes physical coordination and mind-fullness , so it 's going to be the same like playing a musical instrument , it 's going to be the same as doing a sport , dancing , swimming , whatever .`` passion '' and `` power '' ; if you do this enough , if you get to the point where you 're actually making beautiful letters and you 're discovering all the amazing wonderful things that you can do with calligraphy , you 're going to develop a passion for it , and this happens in all the arts .the power , the whole idea of power , i think has to do with the ability to make beautiful things , i consider that a great power , it 's not power over anyone else , it 's a personal power , and it 's a wonderful power .
so the next , to start adding to our four way coordination with jazz is to add a third limb .and what i 'm going to add , is the snare drum .i 'm going to play quarter notes on the snare .meaning , i 'm going to play , one , two , three , four on the snare drum .then combine it , with what 's going on , on our jazz ride pattern and the hi hat .so i 'll just put a couple measures of just the jazz ride pattern , we 've been playing .and then , i 'll just adding in .i 'm not slamming down .this is n't rock , i 'm not playing rim shots over on the snare drum .i 'm. [CLS] [SEP]just playing some light quarter notes on the snare drum .so this is a very basic coordination exercise .it will get that third limb involved .the snare 's not doing anything syncopated or anything weird .you 're just playing one , two , three , four .one , two , three , four .nothing crazy .and then , we can look at adding in the bass drum , next .
the quality depends a lot on where you 're going to be using the table .what i mean by that is a commercial table is very heavy .it 's made of ; the bed of the table is made of slate so that it can take a lot of abuse , a lot of use , a lot of wear and tear .a home table is normally not going to get near the play that a commercial table gets so the slate or that is. [CLS] [SEP]the bed of the table is normally a little thinner .the weight of the , overall weight of the table is going to be less , so it will do fine for home use .but in in a commercial atmosphere it would not last very long before it would start getting out of level and showing a lot of wear .once again , the quality of your table depends an awful lot on the cost that you put into your table .the more expensive tables have the heavier and thicker slate .so , the biggest thing is you need to determine whether or not you 're going to use it for home use or you 're going to use it for commercial use .home use will be less .commercial use ; the table will cost more .

something i 've mentioned in past clips is that a lot of even numbered tricks involve crossing throws , much like you would throw in a cascade .so , what i 'm going to teach you now is basically a crossing pattern with four balls .this is essentially a five-ball pattern with a hole where the five ball would be .so obviously it 's much more easier to do because you 're only dealing with four objects and you can kind of cheat a little bit on the timing to learn .the site swap notation is 5 , 5 , 5 , 5 , 0.it looks like this .from an asynchronous turn , throw all four balls in a high cascade pattern .from that you can return directly to four balls .now try to get it down on both sides starting left handed , and then once you can do it a few times on each side , try to switch back and forth .as you can see , my hand ends up empty occasionally where that fifth ball would be .now this is a great drill for learning five balls , but also because you have to work with the cascade style throws , will prepare you for other tricks .
i 've been teaching 3 year olds up to 50 year olds for 20 years , so if there 's one thing i know , i know how to teach walking and turning on a runway .i 'd like to start with stepping up on the runway .you can practice this at home or anywhere that you have a step .so i 'm going to start right here at the side of the ramp. [CLS] [SEP]and i 'm just going to show you how important it is to focus into your camera , then to take your right foot and step up onto the ramp .the reason i 'm using the right foot is to block the inner-part of the body , the crotch so-to-speak .it 's really not professional to step up with the outside leg .so anytime you 're facing an audience in any type of performance , especially modeling. [CLS] [SEP], you want to be poised and graceful .it 's so important that you put the outside leg up in front of the audience .what i 'd like to do is make sure that you 've got your toes totally to the side of the ramp or the step because you also do n't want to stand back to where you 're lunging in .that 's not graceful as well. [CLS] [SEP], it over-strides your step .so i 'd like for you just to stand right at the edge of your step , right at the edge of the ramp .take the right foot and bring it gracefully up to the ramp and move up .notice that when i do that i do n't bounce .there 's no bounce in the step .what i want you to do is just gracefully get your toes close to the ramp and step up without a bounce , very graceful , very poised .i can do it backwards as well because that trains my body to stay poised , graceful and smooth without a bounce .notice that all the strength is coming from my knees , the strength is not coming from my back .i 'm not curling my shoulders to add to , and. [CLS] [SEP]i 'm not moving my arms with my elbows bent to give me strength to get up .this is the way a lot of people take stairs because it gives their body strength to get up .well i 'm a model. [CLS] [SEP]and i 'm already pretty strong , so to prove my strength. [CLS] [SEP], i 'm going to maintain my posture , pull in my stomach muscles which expands my chest so that it gives me strength by leaving my hands flat to my side , fingertips lightly touching the thighs , and just gracefully put my foot up on the ramp , slowly but surely , gracefully stepping up and down. [CLS] [SEP]so there is no bounce in my step .that 's so important for your first appearance when you 're approaching the ramp .that 's how we approach the ramp gracefully .

[CLS] [SEP]and you get that power and that volume .here 's your upstroke .one more time , we 'll illustrate .you have your traditional grip and you have the three strokes , starting with your upstroke .
something else that you need to keep in mind when you 're working with your horse. [CLS] [SEP]is your horse 's temperament and disposition .if you have a fairly relaxed guy like ice-man , you can take longer to work on different areas as long as they 'll tolerate and they will let you know when they want you to move on and when they 're all done with it .if you have again , a young horse with a short attention span they 're going to be looking around more , they 're going to just not want to stand there for as long as you might like them to .if you have a sort of a flighty , anxious horse like many thoroughbreds can be , you 're going to need to just do everything really slowly , really carefully with them , make sure that you keep one hand on them all the time as you 're moving from area to area .just again , it all boils down to knowing your horse .if you have a bigger horse , a work horse like a belgian or something that you 're wanting to work on , again , they 're going to be pretty laid back in how you approach it. [CLS] [SEP]and they 're probably going to be happy to have you work on them anytime .
so now this is where the real fun begins .is that this is making a test strip .and doing this is very important and again. [CLS] [SEP], it 's back to being , it 's back to being a discipline thing .because a lot of times where i came into the darkroom where i just had a negative off my contact sheet , i just wanted to guesstamite .but guessing is bad .after awhile you see that you waste more paper and you waste more time guessing than if you just do one of these test strips .to do this , i have my timer set at 15 seconds .i have my paper under the easel .and what i do is i use this filter kit box. [CLS] [SEP]and i cover up about , maybe , from a 5 x 7 about 6 inches of the paper. [CLS] [SEP]and i expose .and what i do is i make several exposures while moving the box each time the exposure goes up .like this one would be the first one for 15 seconds .and then i would do it again , moving the box about an inch , and i go from left to right. [CLS] [SEP]and i expose it again .and i do this several times and if you think about it , it makes sense .i never move the paper. [CLS] [SEP]and i never move my timer .i only move the box. [CLS] [SEP]and then i look at what my exposures look like once i pull my print out of the developer .
and , the first part to every bit of the fundamentals starts with base , and the strength at the support of your fundamentals , or your foundation .so , what we 're going to talk about right now is the stance , and the stance is very important on defense .it 's a little bit different than a shot , or something like that .if you 're a shooter , you 're going to be pretty much shoulder width apart , but if you 're a defensive player , you want to be a little bit wider. [CLS] [SEP], you want to have a good , strong base in which you can jump from , in which you can move from , and also you want to try to cover as much ground , as you possibly can .so , the first step is , you want to have your feet a little bit more than shoulder width apart , so you have a good , firm foundation .the second part about the stance is , we 're going to have our butt down , in our stance .you want to have your butt down , and your shoulders or your back straight up .you do n't want to play defense leaning forward , and you do n't want to play it leaning back .you want to be good and have your back straight , so that you can move around , and so that you can work .the other thing is your hands .you want to make sure and have your hands either out , or right here , but. [CLS] [SEP]they 've got to be ready to be used .you know when i look out there , and i see a defender with his hands down , he 's useless to me .he 's got to be able to use his hands .and , the last step , and the last part about having a good stance is , you 've got to be up on your toes .you ca n't be on the balls of your feet , or else you 're not going to be able to move .so , when you get in that stance , you want to be able to kind of bounce around a little bit , up on those toes with a good , wide base , being able to use your hands .and , that 's how you start to become a good defender .
right now we 're going to show you the proper way to measure for a neck measurement on for your shirt .last thing you want is a tight shirt that 's going to make you choke all night .you 're going to be uncomfortable already. [CLS] [SEP]so we want you to be as comfortable as possible .there are three basic shirt types : there are wing-tip collars and there 's the lay down collar , mandarin collar .same thing is in common with all of them though ; they all take the same type of measuring to determine the neck size .so , you do. [CLS] [SEP]that is you go right around the neck above the shirt. [CLS] [SEP]-- there 's actually about three way you can do this -- but pull it tight and then whatever measurement you get add an inch to that .and that 's how i do it most of the time .but there 's another way to do it is you can go around the neck .leave your fingers on the inside of the tape and pull it snug , but you 're going to have a little bit of a gap because of the fingers in there .you really want the shirt to be about an inch bigger than what your neck is so that you 'll be comfortable .the third option would be just to find a dress shirt in the closet that fits nice , usually in the back of the neck will have the size of the shirt and in those cases just write down whatever that shirt size is and that 'll work fine .so , three ways -- all of them should work fine if you take your time and do it right , but leave a little bit of a gap .
when i add compost to my piles , a lot of time , they are really warm .for example , when i 've mulched all the tree branches , it was hot .it was steamy for like three months .at that point , you would never use the mulch .grass clippings and leaves , a lot of times , they compost much quicker and. [CLS] [SEP]when i 'm deciding whether it 's ready or not , the first factor is if it 's warm or not .if it 's heat ...if there 's any heat coming off of it or if you are standing near it. [CLS] [SEP]and it 's warm , then wait ; always give it a couple more months and wait until your compost is really cold .my compost here is almost ready to use .it 's only been here for three or four months on these grass clippings , but if i go underneath , from the very first grass clippings , it is starting to look like soil .it is looking really broken up .it does n't look that much different from the compost that i purchased from the garden center .so , i would n't say it 's quite ready yet , because the pine needles still look like pine needles and the leaves still look like leaves .but , when it 's totally broken down and looks like earth , then that 's a good time to use your mulch .the best thing about mulch and using all of my compost , i can use it as the base of my garden beds and then put the mulch that i purchased from the garden center on top. [CLS] [SEP]and it seems to be a great combination and that way i save a lot of money on the compost that i 've purchased .in the next segment , we 'll talk about how to mulch with compost .

[CLS] [SEP]and you 're not going to have a bad breath .and it also , later on , your puppy may not need to have to have an anesthetic to clean his teeth .and so , it 's really nice if you just kind of take your time now and make it like a daily ritual and make it fun for him .and when you get a toothbrush the first thing you want to do is not just start brushing the teeth , but just let him get used to it .so it 'll take about a month for him to understand what `` brush your teeth ''means .and then , the other thing is there are some special toothbrushes , but it 's very important that you get special toothpaste .the toothpaste that we use is stuff that has no detergent in it , because a puppy does n't know he 's supposed to spit it out .and so , again , we have it in different flavors so that they like the taste of it. [CLS] [SEP]and it makes your job a little bit easier to train your puppy , how to take care of his teeth .another thing that i think is pretty important and stuff that you can do at home , is puppies have a lot of problems with their ears and you can take a little kleenex , maybe a little mineral oil , and again , see how nice your puppy is , because i think you 've already been working on this because he lets you mess with him .a lot of dogs do n't like to be messed with this way .but you can see there 's a little bit of wax down in here .the ear canal goes deep down into the ear and what you want to do with that is just kind of clean the areas that you can see .if you leave the wax alone in there , he 'll wind up , a place for bacteria to grow and predispose your puppy to have ear infections .the other thing that you should be doing is to handle their feet .and you can see their nails .it looks like you 've already trimmed them a little bit , but if you 've handle their feet a lot like this , when he does go to the veterinarian or the groomer and have his nails trimmed , he 's not going to be all worried about somebody messing with his feet .i can see you 've done that .most puppies wo n't let you do that .when you trim his nails , you can see right here. [CLS] [SEP]and you can take off about this much each time .and you have to be careful because there 's a nerve supply and a blood supply that comes down .if you cut it back , even this far , you could make it bleed and it would hurt him .so , if they get hurt with one nail trim when they 're young , then they never want anybody touching their feet again .
i 'm here at everything peaceful in wilmington , north carolina .i 'm here to discuss what is transverse friction massage .transverse means to go across and friction means to just apply pressure to the muscle underneath the skin .so transverse friction massage is basically moving the skin with your fingers transversally over muscle fibers or across the muscle fibers .and basically the point of doing that is to break up any adhesions or muscle knots in the tissue , increase circulation and therefore , increase flexibility of that muscle .and any time that you bring circulation to a muscle , you 're going to decrease the problems that it has as far as pain and discomfort ; things like that .so basically to perform transverse friction massage , you bring the joint into full range , in to full stretch .and then take your fingers and just move across those muscle fibers .and that 's transverse friction massage .

an essential piece of equipment in sharpening your turning tools is going to be a bench grinder .this is a two speed grinder .it operates at a slow speed and a high speed , but i almost exclusively will operate this bench grinder at the lower speed which is about seventeen hundred fifty rpms .it has two wheels and they 're eight inch wheels .this is a sixty grit wheel and i use this wheel if i have to do any reshaping of my tools , and this is an eighty grit wheel and this is a wheel that i will use when i need to just put a fresh edge , or fresh cutting edge , on my tool .it comes with some after market pieces of equipment that are underneath , mounted underneath the wheels , and they 're made , they 're called the wolverine jigs .the wolverine jig are these two sections that are mounted right beneath the two grinding wheels , and on one side we have a flat tool rest that slides in and out , and under this one a v-arm that slides in and out .

[CLS] [SEP]and you 're going to do what we call. [CLS] [SEP]is you 're going to create like a c motion .you 're going to push the floss down , you 're going to curve it over like a c. [CLS] [SEP]and then you 're just going to move it back and forth , like such , push the floss down , curve it over to a c motion and just move it back and forth .so therefore you 're jiggling any debris that might be in between your teeth and then pull the floss through .you 're going to do that on each individual tooth , create a c motion and then just basically , jiggle back and forth. [CLS] [SEP]and then re-free that tooth free of debris .you 're going to do that in between all of your teeth. it 's energetic and it 's fast paced .i like to use bunny when the energy in the room is getting bogged down .when people seem to be getting shy or self conscious .we play bunny .and people start giggling and feeling really silly .and things can get rolling .so i would n't do this with a bunch of complete strangers .but with a group of people who have a little bit knowledge of each other .and need a little energy boost .and here is , how it works .we 'll be in a circle , in a room .and one person is going to start .and they 're going to be the bunny .and they go like this .now i never decided , is this bunny whiskers or is it bunny teeth .that 's up to you .that 's a thing , you can decide .they 're going to go like this .bunny , bunny , bunny , bunny , bunny , bunny .there 's going to be someone on their left .that person is going to be their bunny ears , on this side .and they 're going to be going , bunny , bunny , bunny , bunny .the other person on their right , who is the other side 's bunny ears .and they 're going to be going , bunny , bunny , bunny , bunny .so you can imagine , there 's three people here all going , bunny ,bunny .yeah , there 's this bunny , bunny .and this bunny , bunny .and so every one is going , bunny , bunny , bunny , bunny .and the person in the center , when they 're ready .they throw the bunny to someone across the circle .and that person becomes the bunny .and the people on either side of them , become the bunny ears .so it 's this real , fast pace , silly thing .so it 's really hard to demonstrate by myself .but i 'm going to do a little try at this .and i 'm going to look , especially silly .bunny , bunny , bunny , bunny , bunny , bunny .bunny .and if that was me .bunny , bunny , bunny , bunny , bunny , bunny .bunny .like that and so on and so forth .that is the basic structure of bunny .it is just fast and silly and fun .it 's important to go fast or else. [CLS] [SEP]it feels kind of weird .another variation on that is morphing bunny .so if i was the bunny in the center here .and two people were my ears .and i went like this , bunny , bunny , bunny , bunny , bunny , bunny , bunny , bunny .and i moved from having whiskers to an ear .suddenly , this person on my right , is now the bunny .they 're going , bunny , bunny , bunny , bunny .and this person over here , has to join in , bunny , bunny , bunny , bunny , like .so it morphs , the left or the right .so you can throw it across the circle .you can morph to the left or the right .and that 's advanced bunny and would n't try that , right away .but you can add it , once the group gets a hang of it .so that 's a fun .silly warm up called bunny .

some of the common mistakes you may experience while learning how to do a switch pivot grind will basically be that now you 're traveling up the ramp and. [CLS] [SEP]before you get there you 're building a little bit of a curve before you hit the coping and this gets you the momentum to get the grind going .so a lot of the problems are going to occur approaching the ramp or coping in the correct way and making sure that you have control of it because once you get into the grind position it may shoot out on you .so what you 're going to want to do is learn this trick with smaller grinds first meaning. [CLS] [SEP]just head up the ramp at a small degree , do a short grind and come in .the more used to get to the positioning and the grind feeling the better you 'll be when it comes time to get a long locked switch pivot and come in .so another problem you may experience while learning how to do these switch pivot grinds is you may find that different coping is going to be a lot faster than others .some coping as soon as you hit it it 's going to be very fast .some coping when you hit it. [CLS] [SEP]it 's going to be slow. [CLS] [SEP]and you 'll have to push it .the only way to do , to feel comfortable doing this , is to practice as much as possible on the obstacle that you 're skating and make sure that your speed and your approach , the angle that you 're needed , is the right one for the coping that you are skating on .you do n't want to make too much of a turn if your coping is really fast .you 'll need less of a turn to get into slick coping , and for coping that sticks you 'll need to give yourself more of a degree of an angle to get into it to force it across and to grind it .these are just some of the common mistakes with a switch pivot grind .
you know one thing that 's going to make your game look really cool , and spectacular is a 360 dunk .it 's not something that you 're probably going to need during the game , but it 's something that can take your game to the next level , and if you 're really looking for exposure , to make it to the nba , or to college , this is something that can really do it .hi , i 'm travis , and this is how you do that 360 dunk .what you want to do during 360 dunk is , it 's a little different than a regular dunk because when you 're doing a 360 dunk , you want to make sure that you turn your body once you get in the air .so , you step first. [CLS] [SEP]-- that 's the same thing as any other dunk .you step first , and then you take off .and once you take off and raise that right foot , or if you 're coming from the left side , step with the right and raise that left foot , you want to make sure that you spin , and keep in your mind exactly where that rim is , because you 're not going to be able -- you 're going to for a split second. [CLS] [SEP], you 're not going to see the rim .so , you take off , and you 're in the air .you make sure you spin your body .turn your torso and the rest of your body will come .turn your torso , the rest of your body will follow , and then make sure you get the ball high enough -- spot the rim , you want to spot the rim .it 's just like dancing .you want to spot it .you spot it on the way up , spin , spot it on the way when you come back around , and once you spot that rim , put the ball over and dunk it through .there you have it , 360 dunking .

in this clip we 're going to be learning how to do finger spins .a finger spin is , here , when you put it on your finger and spin it over once .okay ?now , the most important part is , finding the balance of your kama .once you find the balance you 're going to have to be able to find it quickly , just stick your finger there , without messing up .so , you 're going to take your finger and put it right above that balancing point. [CLS] [SEP]and you 're going to throw it .you 're going to throw it , pull it towards you , it 's going to rotate around. [CLS] [SEP]and it 's going to catch that balancing point .put it in your hand. [CLS] [SEP], like this , hold it , you 're going to throw , flip it around , roll your finger with it all the way back into your hand .so , one more time from here , spin and catch .there you go , and that 's going to be your finger spin .now , when you get it down , go ahead and try and do two spins .so , you 're going to take your finger , put it about , way up here. [CLS] [SEP], two finger links above .so , you 're going to roll it , and then roll it around again , all the way to a catch .so , from here , two spins .there you go .one more time .okay , sometimes it might come off your finger ,naturally just rotate , just go in and catch it and play it off .but , if you ca n't keep your finger on it the whole time , you 're going to be moving your hand in this motion of spinning towards you .so , get those finger spins down , get real comfortable with it , make sure you can find the weight of your kama. [CLS] [SEP]so you can do some really cool spins. m going to show you how to make a cute little bag out of regular everyday fabrics .in this next step we 're going to sew together our bag .the outside of our bag .so you can see that i left it exactly how it was on the cutting table .i have the right sides pinned together and i have a half an inch seam allowance .and i like to use just a regular old simple stitch .if you have a good machine and you do n't really need to do an exaggerated heavy stitch you can just use a simple stitch .also the fact that we have a lining means that it 's ok for not using a big crazy stitch on the outside because we have a lining .so everything that goes in the bag is going to be in the lining .it 's going to take some weight off of the outside of the bag. [CLS] [SEP]and you 're going to have fewer holes and less worries .so we 're going to go ahead and start sewing .whenever you sew the very first few stitches , you 're going to sew forward. [CLS] [SEP]and then you 're going to press a button right here .it should be a button .sometimes you twist a knob on the side ; it depends on your sewing machine .but usually you 'll have a button right here .you 're going to press it .you 're going to sew backwards a little bit .and that 's just going to secure your seam .and make sure to remove your pins as you go .when you get to any corner , you want to go backwards and forwards a little bit because corners take all heat , all the weight .and what you want to do is whenever you are getting to a corner , instead of lifting up and moving everything around. [CLS] [SEP], you just want to lift up and twist so that you stay , so that you get a perfect edge .you want to make sure you 're on the line and that you get a perfect edge .ok .

[CLS] [SEP]i stretch the hand out .he 'll still have a little bit of control here and by striking into the wrist i get a natural flexation of the wrist which causes the fingers to stretch out which allows the knife to fly away .so once again as daniel comes in i 'm striking into the forearm , down into the arm , down into the wrist , hand comes up , the knife comes out .and that 's a nice inside parrying striking technique for a straight stab .

today we 're going to learn a couple old school tricks .now the term old school just refers to tricked that were originated in the mid to late 80 's , early 90 's , usually have a lot of flair , just real smooth surfer kind of style influence , cruising tricks .one of the first tricks that was originated in the streets and on ramps is something called a power slide .you have a front side power slide when you 're actually facing the direction that you 're sliding and you 'll slide with your wheels in a direction like this .it 's just being light on the toes and back in the day they had soft wheels , and just power slide and make a lot of noise , have a lot of fun .you can , you know , put your hand down and make it a little more stylish , whatever you prefer .then you have the back side power slide .back side power slide is when you 're sliding , your back is facing the direction that you 're going , once again , you 're just sliding your wheels along the ramp light on your feet , just kind of putting your own style on the trick .another old school trick would be the bean plant , and the bean plant , you 're just going to cruise up to any surface , it could be a sidewalk , it could be an embankment , it could be flat ground , you 're then going to take one foot off , one foot on , and do a hop , and land back on your board , grabbing the board right in the center .i 'll now demonstrate how to do a front side power slide , back side power slide , and a bean plant .and that 's how to do old school tricks .

scoring systems in pinochle , there are three , actually three primary ways that scoring is accomplished in the game .it does n't matter which one as long as you know what scoring system is going to be employed .progressive scoring , progressive scoring combines the add on feature and the use of not having the subtraction option but having the add on feature .let 's look for an example .supposing the opponents have bid sixty-five and they do have the required twenty meld and let 's just say that we happen to have twenty-two meld which is very important .let us suppose that they only had thirty meld , this is thirty meld right here .now they obviously have to pull the difference between thirty meld and sixty-five , they have to pull thirty-five counters .again , here 's the relationship between this and this .they have thirty meld , they have bid sixty-five , and they need thirty-five counters , thirty-five out of a possible fifty available in the play of the hand .if they fall short , if they fall short , they do n't get that thirty-five , right , then they have lost their bid and their bid goes over to our score .now if they only pulled say thirty counters. [CLS] [SEP]then we would have pulled the other twenty and we add that on to our meld plus their sixty-five .that 's a big haul for us. [CLS] [SEP]is n't it ?
the next stretch that we 're looking at is the cobra , or at least that 's what it 's referred to in yoga .it 's , you can do an elbow cobra , and what you 're trying to do is , you 're trying to keep your back straight , and you 're trying to cut yourself at your lower back , and trying to open up your abdomen , your hips , and trying to get some blood flow going through into your quadriceps , and through the major veins and arteries of the front of the body .now if you find yourself fairly flexible , try to come up even higher .but if your hips are coming up off the floor because of it , go back down , you 're not flexible enough yet to actually get there .but the more flexible you become , the more you can start working with it and trying to get your body to relax .so i 'm not quite at the point of being able to grab my feet ,but i can relax enough to keep my hips on the floor and keep everything relatively loose and easy going .stretch forward just to help stretch the shoulders out a little bit , bend the neck and the head , and try to continue relaxing the lower back , and that pelvis down , keep your shoulders light and relaxed .
so what is an interview .well a job interview is a formal meeting between a potential employee and employer or a potential employer .the job interview has two purposes .for the employer , it is to find the best person that is suited for that job .for you , the employee , it is an opportunity to find the best job that suits your needs and this happens through a series of questioning and exchange of information .now , when you 're getting ready to start looking for a job , especially if you are in college .sometimes college kids start as early as nine months , looking for a job , because the job interview process is actually quite lengthy .i 'm going to give you some quick statistics .for every ten jobs you interview , that 's the average , you 'll interview for ten jobs , in order to get one .so we really want to brush up your interviewing skills .you may go on a average of twenty to thirty job interviews before you find the right job for you , that wants to hire you .so fasten your seat belts , here we go .

in this clip we will be talking about the time signatures that are less common .they will include 5/4 , 9/8 , and 12/8 .so the first 5/4 is a time signature that can be divided up into either 2 3 or 3 2 , and it refers to whether it 's 2 3 or 3 2 depends on the piece and the music and the feeling of the music will define whether or not it 's a 2 3 or a 3 2 , and this can come up with a couple of different time signatures , and it will say a little 3 2 above the time signature .so , the 5/4 and a 2 3 pattern would be down , left , right , right , up , down , left , right , right , up .and then , a 3 2 would be down , left , left , right , up , left , left , right , up .so , that 's usually how you 'll do it , and it will say it in the score above the time signature if it 's a 2 3 or 3 2.the next is 9/8 , and that is one , two , three , four , five , six , seven , eight , nine ; one , two , three , four , five , six , seven , eight , nine ; and it 's pretty straightforward .12/8. [CLS] [SEP]is kind of like 9/8. [CLS] [SEP]it 's just three extra beats , so. [CLS] [SEP]it 's one , two , three , four , five , six , seven , eight , nine , ten , eleven , twelve ; one , two , three , four , five , six , seven , eight , nine , ten , eleven , twelve .so you 'll go down , right , right , left , left , left , right , right , right ,right , up , up , up .and , in books and stuff if you look up conducting in books , the patterns will be described exactly like that , so it exactly creates arches , and then to the right , and then up .and it makes a little more sense when you see it in a book .

[CLS] [SEP]and then the playlist will be populated by songs that fit those rules .so , you see that the rules that we can set , these are all the things that you see in itunes .you see name , time , artists ; these are all the possible things that you can see .just for an example , i 'll pick the 'name ' which is the song name. [CLS] [SEP]and then you pick the parameter which is contains , does not contain , is ,is not , starts with , ends with .so , it contains all type of words , in any song name that has that word , anywhere in the name will be there and the opposite for does not contain is -- means , it is exactly that .so , if i type two words , it will be exactly those two words .is not , just the opposite and then starts and ends with , pretty self-explanatory .but contains is probably the easiest one to demonstrate .let 's just see -- make a smart playlist of every song that contains the word `` love '' .and then your other options are to limit it to a certain amount items and when you do limit it , you select by random or you select by these parameters , match. [CLS] [SEP]only checked items and live updating ; this is when if i import a new cd that match these parameters , it would be added automatically .so , probably , you want to keep that checked because that 's the coolest thing about smart playlist.
